name: Nobu
summary: An upscale restaurant offering exquisite Japanese-Peruvian cuisine, Nobu is known for its signature dishes like black cod miso. The sophisticated ambiance makes it a great spot for special occasions or an elegant night out. Unique decor and attentive service enhance the dining experience.
address: 57-58 fl, The Empire, 1 S Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Yan Nawa, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: OXBO Bangkok
summary: A vibrant restaurant specializing in seasonal and international cuisine offers a dynamic menu that changes with the seasons. Guests can expect a fresh take on classic dishes, all made from locally sourced ingredients. The open kitchen design allows diners to watch chefs at work, enhancing the dining experience.
address: 3rd floor, 123 Charoen Nakhon Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Ton Sai, Khet Khlong San, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10600, Thailand

name: Copine
summary: A modern café offering a selection of artisanal pastries and specialty coffee. The inviting atmosphere is perfect for casual meet-ups or quiet work sessions. Unique artwork by local artists adorns the walls, enhancing the creative vibe.
address: 58 Soi Sathon 9, Khwaeng Yan Nawa, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Pizza Studio Tamaki
summary: A vibrant pizzeria offers a build-your-own pizza experience with fresh ingredients and creative toppings. Perfect for casual dining, the space is designed for both quick bites and relaxed meals. A unique feature includes an open kitchen where guests can watch their pizzas being made.
address: PHMG+4PR Town Hall, Sukhumvit 49, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: BANG
summary: A vibrant bar with a lively atmosphere, offering an extensive selection of craft cocktails and local beers. Perfect for social gatherings, the space features unique decor and frequent live music events. Enjoy a welcoming vibe that encourages mingling and relaxation.
address: 45, 1 Thanon Phra Athit, Khwaeng Chana Songkhram, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand

name: Samsara Cafe & Meal
description_full: Located in Song Wat Road, Samsara Cafe feels like one of those secret spots only locals know about. The wooden deck juts out right over the river, so you’re practically sitting on the water. This is one of the most peaceful sunset spots in town. Samsara’s menu features everything from Thai comfort food to craft beers, making it the perfect laid-back evening hangout. Song Wat Rd, Samphanthawong. 086-978-9331. Open daily 5pm-12am. Closed Monday.
summary: A hidden gem along the river, this café offers a serene atmosphere perfect for unwinding at sunset. The diverse menu features Thai comfort food and craft beers, ideal for a casual evening. With its wooden deck extending over the water, the setting enhances every meal.
address: 1612 Song Wat Rd, Khwaeng Samphanthawong, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand

name: Custard Nakamura
description_full: A staple in Phrom Phong for nearly three decades, Custard Nakamura is a Japanese-style bakery that constantly draws crowds. A franchise from Ichikawa, Chiba, Japan, this bakery prides itself on using imported Japanese ingredients, ensuring a distinct taste that sets it apart from other bakeries in Bangkok. While it offers a variety of sweet and savoury pastries, the standout items include a minced pork sandwich featuring a crispy fried pork cutlet nestled between two slices of fluffy white bread, and strawberry sandwich, which perfectly balances freshness and sweetness. Despite its popularity, the bakery remains relatively affordable, making it a must-visit spot for locals and tourists. Sukhumvit 33/1, Khlong Tan Nuea, Bangkok. 02-259-9630. Open daily 9am-9pm.
summary: A popular Japanese-style bakery in Phrom Phong, this venue offers a unique taste with imported ingredients. Standout items include a crispy fried pork cutlet sandwich and a refreshing strawberry sandwich. Affordable prices make it an inviting spot for both locals and tourists.
address: 595/2 Soi Sukhumvit 33/1, เเขวง คลองตันเหนือ Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Unatoto Thailand
description_full: Unatoto Thailand is not just another Japanese eatery – it’s the first international branch of a beloved chain with 20 locations across Japan. Staying true to its roots, Unatoto delivers the same authentic flavours and dining experience as its Japanese counterparts. What truly sets Unatoto apart is its signature grilling technique, which uses a special charcoal stove to infuse the eel with a rich, smokey aroma while achieving a perfectly tender texture. To ensure authenticity, both the eel and seasonings are imported directly from Japan. Diners can savour a variety of cuts and preparation styles, each capturing the essence of a traditional Japanese eel feast. 591, 11-12 Sukhumvit Rd, Khlong Tan Nuea, Bangkok. 088-575-8788. Open daily 10am-9pm.
summary: A unique Japanese restaurant, this venue specializes in authentic eel dishes prepared using a traditional charcoal grilling technique. Importing both eel and seasonings from Japan ensures a genuine dining experience. Perfect for those seeking rich flavors, the ambiance reflects a true taste of Japanese culture.
address: 591, 11-12 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Unbirthday Cafe
description_full: Found in the Mapengseng apartment building, Unbirthday Café has been a quiet yet consistent presence in Phrom Phong for more than five years. The creation of the team behind Dandelion, it offers a thoughtful take on minimalist, everyday desserts. The name reflects the philosophy that one shouldn’t need a birthday as an excuse to enjoy cake. Each dessert is meticulously crafted, balancing sophistication and warmth. The presentation, from cakes to the thoughtfully curated tableware, adds to the charm, making it an inviting space for those seeking a relaxed yet refined dessert experience. 2/F Mapengseng Apt. 14 Sukhumvit 31, Khlong Tan Nuea, Bangkok. 085-145-3181. Open daily 8am-7pm.
summary: A minimalist café tucked inside the Mapengseng apartment building offers a serene atmosphere for dessert lovers. Specialties include meticulously crafted cakes that invite indulgence without the need for a special occasion. Thoughtful presentation and curated tableware enhance the inviting charm of this refined spot.
address: 2c Apartment Mapengseng 14 Sukhumvit 31, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Larder BKK
description_full: Larder is where Bangkok’s off-duty chefs and food obsessives sneak off to when they want to eat like civilians. It’s low-key industrial with a clean aesthetic, but the food is quietly high-performance. Nothing screams for attention, but everything, from the sourdough tuna sandwich to the house-made focaccia, has that we-actually-care-about-technique energy. Tuna 3000 is a standout: sourdough topped with tartar sauce, soft-boiled egg, and tuna, served with a side of chips. Breakfast sets feel like they’ve gone through R&D. Guests can also choose from a variety of fresh pastries. If you’re a brunch purist who still wants to be surprised, come here. 31/2 Phrom Chai Alley, Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana. 093-009-4494. Open daily 8am-5pm.
summary: A low-key café in Bangkok attracts chefs and food lovers seeking quality brunch. Fresh pastries and dishes like the Tuna 3000 showcase a commitment to technique without fuss. The clean, industrial space enhances the relaxed vibe for casual dining.
address: 31/2 Soi Phrom Chai, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Butterbear
description_full: Butterbear, the mascot of Butterbear Café, has transcended its role as a simple dessert shop character to become a full-fledged pop culture icon. Initially part of the Coffee Beans by Dao chain, Butterbear gained widespread recognition because of its endearing design and viral social media presence, particularly among Chinese tourists. The brainchild of Boom Thanawan, daughter of Coffee Beans by Dao’s founder, Butterbear has even ventured into the T-pop industry with singles that have expanded its fan base. Ultra-fans can meet the character in person at the Butterbear shop at the ground floor of Emsphere, where scheduled appearances take place every Friday, Saturday and Sunday. G/F Emsphere, Sukhumvit Rd, Khlong Tan, Bangkok. 082-930-6333. Open daily 10am-9pm.
summary: A vibrant café, Butterbear offers a delightful range of desserts with a unique pop culture twist. Fans can meet the adorable mascot during scheduled appearances on weekends, making it a fun spot for social media enthusiasts. Set in Emsphere, the café's playful atmosphere attracts both locals and tourists alike.
address: G Floor, Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Golden State Vegan
description_full: What is it?: A Japanese/Californian fusion restaurant with a cocktail bar and DJ deck that gets livelier by the hour as the evening progresses. Why we love it?: No artificial meats are used and the sauces are all imagined in house in this third floor shophouse walk-up, as they constantly dabble with the perfect way to enhance the mostly Californian sushi-oriented menu plates, each as colourfully presented as the decor. This is some of the finest vegan comfort food in the city and the laid back vibe totally matches partners, Oranan and Erics’, views on life in general, and that is to have fun and to take care of those around you. WTF sushi rolls will knock your socks off as the mango chili dressing needs the wasabi side to cool it down. The quinoa-based burger offering comes in the softest of buns, house ketchup and mayonnaise, plus skinny fries as good as they get. There is a limited selection of six well-chosen wines and a bar team that mixes all of the cocktail favourites. Live music is offered on some evenings, so check out their social pages for information. Time Out tip: Oranan also runs Hidden Closet, one of the best female sex toy and fetish-oriented businesses in town with a shop tucked away behind the restaurant.. She and her team are always happy to show you around and let you sample the goods, if that’s your thing.
summary: A vibrant Japanese-Californian fusion restaurant, this spot serves innovative vegan sushi and comfort food in a lively atmosphere. Specialties include unique WTF sushi rolls and a quinoa burger, all enhanced by house-made sauces. Live music and craft cocktails add to its dynamic vibe, making it perfect for an evening out.
address: 3rd Floor RR Space, Soi Sukhumvit 33, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: (un)FASHION District S39
description_full: More than a cafe and probably Phrom Phong’s best-kept style secret, (un)FASHION District S39 combines coffee culture, culinary treats and eclectic shopping in an inviting shaded setting. The laid-back atmosphere helps to attract a bohemian mix of coffee lovers, foodies and vintage enthusiasts, all of whom can browse through a selection of pre-loved shoes, bags, and accessories and then enjoy a carefully brewed cup of coffee or a delicious meal. The wooden interiors, accented by warm lighting, enhances the cosy ambiance, making it a great place to relax individually or socialise at leisure with friends. 19, 5 Sukhumvit 39, Khlong Tan Nuea, Bangkok. 080-446-1650. Open daily 10am-8.30pm.
summary: A cozy café blends coffee culture with culinary delights and vintage shopping in a shaded setting. Bohemian vibes attract coffee lovers and foodies alike, who can browse pre-loved accessories while enjoying a crafted brew or meal. The warm wooden interiors create an inviting atmosphere for relaxation or socializing.
address: 19, 5 Soi Sukhumvit 39, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Bar.Yard
description_full: Bar.Yard should be no stranger to folks who know Bangkok’s nightlife scene or fans of rooftop bars. This is the third year in a row the venue has earned the top spot from the BAD Awards voting panel in the rooftop bar category, and that’s largely because the venue keeps refining its best-in-class formula. This year, it launched an all-new line-up of weekly parties called “Nights at the Yard”, creating a good mixture of vibes and energy levels here with everything from ladies nights to more off-the-cuff parties and cosmopolitan dance-offs. Combine that with the already good food and drink and you have a home run yet again.
summary: A vibrant rooftop venue, this spot is known for its lively atmosphere and diverse weekly parties. Specialty cocktails and delicious bites complement the energetic vibe, making it ideal for socializing and dancing. With panoramic views of Bangkok, the setting enhances every experience.
address: Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok, 78 Soi Ton Son, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Nobu Rooftop
description_full: Nobu Bangkok was one of the most highly anticipated openings of 2024, commanding a large media junket and acting as the main promotional vehicle for the larger EA Rooftop launch at the top of Empire Tower. While the restaurant takes up most of the limelight, the open-air rooftop bar area has quietly stolen the show, and our panelists agreed. Completely booked nearly every night, what the bar area lacks in raw mixologist firepower it more than makes up for with some of the most insane 360-degree views you find in the city.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar, this spot offers stunning 360-degree views of the city. Known for its lively atmosphere, it attracts crowds almost every night despite a simpler cocktail menu. Perfect for unwinding with friends after a long day, the ambience is truly captivating.
address: 57-58 fl, The Empire, 1 S Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Yan Nawa, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Finalist: Penthouse Bar + Grill
description_full: ThreeSixty Rooftop BarPhoto: ThreeSixty Rooftop Bar / FacebookPerched on the 32nd floor of the Millennium Hilton, ThreeSixty Rooftop Bar lives up to its name with sweeping 360-degree views over the Chao Phraya River that are hard to match. Whether you're lounging near the helipad or tucked into one of the sofas under the stars, it’ll be hard to match the vibes here on this side of the river. The sunset scene pairs well with a French 75—a crisp mix of gin, lemon, and sparkling wine—or the Grand Cosmopolitan, made with Absolut Elyx and Grand Marnier for a smooth, citrus-forward sip. The classic cocktail list covers all the bases, and a solid Champagne selection will help you turn up the celebration when needed. DJs, garden accents, and a cool-as-hell helipad help to take this rooftop spot over the edge. ThreeSixty Rooftop Bar,  Millennium Hilton Bangkok, 123 Charoen Nakhon Rd, .  daily 5pm-1am.
summary: Perched on the 32nd floor, this rooftop bar offers stunning 360-degree views of the Chao Phraya River. Signature cocktails like the French 75 and a vibrant atmosphere with DJs create an unforgettable experience. Perfect for sunset lounging or celebrating under the stars.
address: 34th - 36th Floor, Park Hyatt Bangkok, 88 ถ. วิทยุ แขวงลุมพินี เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand

name: Finalist: Com’On Bar
description_full: One of the youngest entries to crack this list in years, opening in just 2023, Com’On Bar’s location just on the outskirts of the city’s old town keeps it far away from the gleaming high rises of the business districts, allowing its perch on the seventh floor to offer 270-degree views of the surrounding area, which the bar team gives nods too through their area-themed drinks like the smoky-flavored “Old Town” the housing number of the building with the crisp “One One Four”. A respectable selection of craft beers on tap rounds out the menu.
summary: Perched on the seventh floor, this bar offers stunning 270-degree views of the city. The menu features area-themed cocktails like the smoky 'Old Town' and a solid selection of craft beers on tap. A laid-back vibe makes it perfect for enjoying drinks while soaking in the scenery.
address: 114 Trok Salak Hin, Khwaeng Rong Muang, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: ThreeSixty Rooftop Bar
description_full: Head up to Bangkok’s sky-high Peruvian-Japanese rooftop restaurant and bar in Bangkok for panoramic sunset views, zesty pisco sours, and innovative fusion cocktails. They provide Nikkei food, a combination of Peruvian and Japanese cuisine, so be sure to try the ceviche sampling plate, tacos, or the South American grilled platter. The rooftop's sleek and fashionable design draws inspiration from Central Park in New York City, and the space is outfitted with artificial grass, wooden structure trees, neon blue and pink lights, a maze, and, to top it all off, a bathroom with a view of the Bangkok cityscape.
summary: A stylish rooftop bar offers stunning sunset views over Bangkok while serving creative Peruvian-Japanese fusion cocktails and dishes. Signature drinks include zesty pisco sours, complemented by a ceviche sampling plate and grilled platters. The space features artificial grass and vibrant neon lights, adding to its chic ambiance.
address: 123 Charoen Nakhon Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Ton Sai, Khet Khlong San, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10600, Thailand

name: Penthouse Bar + Grill
description_full: ThreeSixty Rooftop BarPhoto: ThreeSixty Rooftop Bar / FacebookPerched on the 32nd floor of the Millennium Hilton, ThreeSixty Rooftop Bar lives up to its name with sweeping 360-degree views over the Chao Phraya River that are hard to match. Whether you're lounging near the helipad or tucked into one of the sofas under the stars, it’ll be hard to match the vibes here on this side of the river. The sunset scene pairs well with a French 75—a crisp mix of gin, lemon, and sparkling wine—or the Grand Cosmopolitan, made with Absolut Elyx and Grand Marnier for a smooth, citrus-forward sip. The classic cocktail list covers all the bases, and a solid Champagne selection will help you turn up the celebration when needed. DJs, garden accents, and a cool-as-hell helipad help to take this rooftop spot over the edge. ThreeSixty Rooftop Bar,  Millennium Hilton Bangkok, 123 Charoen Nakhon Rd, .  daily 5pm-1am.
summary: Perched high above the city, this rooftop bar offers stunning views of the Chao Phraya River. Specialty cocktails like the French 75 and Grand Cosmopolitan complement a vibrant ambiance featuring DJs and lush garden accents. Perfect for sunset gatherings or late-night celebrations, it’s a stylish escape in Bangkok.
address: 34th - 36th Floor, Park Hyatt Bangkok, 88 ถ. วิทยุ แขวงลุมพินี เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand

name: Com’On Bar
description_full: One of the youngest entries to crack this list in years, opening in just 2023, Com’On Bar’s location just on the outskirts of the city’s old town keeps it far away from the gleaming high rises of the business districts, allowing its perch on the seventh floor to offer 270-degree views of the surrounding area, which the bar team gives nods too through their area-themed drinks like the smoky-flavored “Old Town” the housing number of the building with the crisp “One One Four”. A respectable selection of craft beers on tap rounds out the menu.
summary: A rooftop bar with stunning 270-degree views, this spot boasts area-themed cocktails like the smoky 'Old Town'. Craft beer lovers will appreciate the solid selection on tap. Perfect for unwinding after a day of exploring the old town's charm.
address: 114 Trok Salak Hin, Khwaeng Rong Muang, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Above Eleven
description_full: Head up to Bangkok’s sky-high Peruvian-Japanese rooftop restaurant and bar in Bangkok for panoramic sunset views, zesty pisco sours, and innovative fusion cocktails. They provide Nikkei food, a combination of Peruvian and Japanese cuisine, so be sure to try the ceviche sampling plate, tacos, or the South American grilled platter. The rooftop's sleek and fashionable design draws inspiration from Central Park in New York City, and the space is outfitted with artificial grass, wooden structure trees, neon blue and pink lights, a maze, and, to top it all off, a bathroom with a view of the Bangkok cityscape.
summary: A stylish Peruvian-Japanese rooftop restaurant offers stunning sunset views alongside innovative fusion cocktails. Specialties include ceviche and grilled South American dishes, all set in a chic environment inspired by Central Park. With its vibrant lighting and unique design elements, the space creates a memorable atmosphere for dining and socializing.
address: Fraser Suites, 38/8 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Anju Korean Rooftop Bar
description_full: Anju Korean Rooftop Bar is Bangkok's first and tallest Korean rooftop bar. Located on the 31st floor of the Sindhorn Midtown Hotel Bangkok, this spot offers panoramic views of Bangkok's cityscape. The bar plays true K-pop music for  K-pop fans, and the menu includes Korean comfort foods such as cheese tteobokki, shrimp ramyun, sizzling hot stir-fried baby octopus, and fried chicken. Drinks include distinctive cocktails made with Korean spirits and infusions of savory ingredients. “Anju” means “food eaten with alcohol," and it doesn't disappoint.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar perched on the 31st floor, offering stunning views of Bangkok. Korean comfort food like tteobokki and unique cocktails made with local spirits create a lively atmosphere perfect for K-pop fans. Late-night vibes are enhanced by the energetic playlist and cozy setting.
address: 68 Soi Langsuan, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Seen Restaurant and Bar
description_full: Nobu Bangkok was one of the most highly anticipated openings of 2024, commanding a large media junket and acting as the main promotional vehicle for the larger EA Rooftop launch at the top of Empire Tower. While the restaurant takes up most of the limelight, the open-air rooftop bar area has quietly stolen the show, and our panelists agreed. Completely booked nearly every night, what the bar area lacks in raw mixologist firepower it more than makes up for with some of the most insane 360-degree views you find in the city.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar offers stunning 360-degree views of the city, making it a sought-after spot for nightlife. Specialty cocktails complement the lively atmosphere, drawing in guests nearly every night. Perfect for unwinding after a long day, the setting enhances the overall experience.
address: AVANI Riverside Bangkok 257/1-3 Charoen Nakhon Rd, Khwaeng Samre, Khet Thon Buri, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10600, Thailand

name: ABar Rooftop
description_full: Bar.Yard should be no stranger to folks who know Bangkok’s nightlife scene or fans of rooftop bars. This is the third year in a row the venue has earned the top spot from the BAD Awards voting panel in the rooftop bar category, and that’s largely because the venue keeps refining its best-in-class formula. This year, it launched an all-new line-up of weekly parties called “Nights at the Yard”, creating a good mixture of vibes and energy levels here with everything from ladies nights to more off-the-cuff parties and cosmopolitan dance-offs. Combine that with the already good food and drink and you have a home run yet again.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar in Bangkok, this venue offers a mix of lively weekly parties and laid-back evenings. Specialty cocktails pair well with a creative menu, making it a great spot for both socializing and relaxing. The atmosphere is enhanced by stunning views and an energetic crowd.
address: 199 Sukhumvit Soi 22, Klongton, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Aesop’s
description_full: Relocating to their plush and extremely well-designed space in Thonglor, the plate-smashing Greek food specialists at Aesop’s took special brand of partying to the rooftop late in 2023. The newer location promises a view over Benjakitti park on the 25th floor rooftop, with interior design taking a cue from Athens. Pop around to check out the high ceilings, marble accents, Greek-style columns, and statues throughout.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar showcases Greek cuisine with a stylish twist, offering stunning views of Benjakitti Park. High ceilings and marble accents create an inviting atmosphere, perfect for enjoying crafted cocktails. The space combines modern design with classic Greek elements, making it a unique spot to unwind.
address: Column Bangkok Hotel, Soi Sukhumvit 16, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Aire Bar
description_full: Hyatt Place enters the rooftop-bar fray with this no-frills, Benjasiri Park-view venue that’s ideal for after-work drinking. All signature cocktails are B    15, Bangkok, .  daily 3pm-1am. Bangkok Heightz
summary: A rooftop bar with a laid-back atmosphere offers stunning views of Benjasiri Park, making it perfect for after-work relaxation. Signature cocktails provide a delightful twist, inviting guests to unwind in style. Open daily from late afternoon to early morning, the venue caters to night owls and casual drinkers alike.
address: 22 5 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: AmBar
description_full: Now known for their big bachata events every Sunday, AmBar is the place to be on Sukhumvit Soi  11.
summary: Known for vibrant bachata events every Sunday, the bar offers a lively atmosphere on Sukhumvit Soi 11. Specialty cocktails and a diverse sports viewing experience enhance the social vibe. Perfect for those looking to unwind with friends or dance the night away.
address: Sukhumvit 15, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Bangkok Heightz
description_full: This  27, .  daily 5pm-1am. CactusYen Akat is getting livelier by the minute. Here you get to enjoy big trees and low-rise building views. The bar maintains a connection with the greenery through a glass wall, so you don't feel trapped in a boxy room like most cocktail bars. The drinks are tasty and easy to down, which goes hand-in-hand with the easy-going vibe this sports bar.  15 Yen Akat Rd., .  daily 5pm-midnight. Char
summary: A lively bar in CactusYen Akat, it offers stunning low-rise building views and lush greenery through a glass wall. Drinks are easy to enjoy, perfectly matching the relaxed atmosphere ideal for sports fans. Open daily from 5pm, this spot invites you to unwind after a long day.
address: 413 ชั้น 39, โรงแรม เดอะ คอนทิเนนท์, Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Brewski
description_full: This beer bar offers  27, .  daily 5pm-1am. CactusYen Akat is getting livelier by the minute. Here you get to enjoy big trees and low-rise building views. The bar maintains a connection with the greenery through a glass wall, so you don't feel trapped in a boxy room like most cocktail bars. The drinks are tasty and easy to down, which goes hand-in-hand with the easy-going vibe this sports bar.  15 Yen Akat Rd., .  daily 5pm-midnight. Char
summary: A lively beer bar features a glass wall that connects patrons with lush greenery and low-rise building views. Specialty drinks are easy to enjoy, enhancing the laid-back atmosphere perfect for sports fans. Open daily from 5 PM to midnight, it invites guests to unwind in a cozy setting.
address: Radisson Blu Plaza 489 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Cactus
description_full: This beer bar offers  Along with a free and easy party atmosphere, Brewski offers an international selection of beers, with choices ranging from American craft beers to Belgian classics. There's also a decent selection of ciders (try the Zeffer Crisp Green Apple Cider from New Zealand) and Thai-style bar munchies like sai krok Isaan (Thai-style pork sausages with fresh chili, ginger, and peanuts).
summary: A lively beer bar with an international selection, the venue features American craft brews alongside Belgian classics. Unique Thai-style snacks like sai krok Isaan complement the drinks perfectly. The relaxed atmosphere makes it ideal for social gatherings and casual evenings.
address: 15 Thanon Yen Akat, Khwaeng Chong Nonsi, Khet Yan Nawa, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Char
description_full: Over at the grill at this rooftop bar, they cook up some amazing beef from Australia's Darling Downs. Char takes up the top two stories of Hotel Indigo, with a stylish dining room downstairs and the rooftop bar up above to benefit from those amazing views across Bangkok's greenery. ​​​​​​ Hotel Indigo,  Arkapat,         11, .  daily 5pm-1am.
summary: A stylish rooftop bar offers stunning views of Bangkok's greenery while serving premium beef from Australia's Darling Downs. The elegant dining area downstairs complements the vibrant atmosphere above, perfect for enjoying a relaxed evening. Open daily from 5 PM to 1 AM, it invites locals and visitors alike to unwind with great food and drinks.
address: 25th & 26th Floor, Hotel Indigo Bangkok, 81 ถ. วิทยุ แขวงลุมพินี เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand

name: Cielo Sky Bar & Restaurant
description_full: The Swanky EmQuartier dedicates some fifth-floor, mall-top space to a venue that’s part tapas bar, part tiki bar, and wholly committed to its “downtown beach club” theme. Instagram-ready nooks litter the huge, tropical-plant and pink-flamingo festooned area.  The EmQuartier,  Arkapat,         11, .  daily 5pm-1am.
summary: A vibrant rooftop venue blends a tapas and tiki bar atmosphere, perfect for unwinding with friends. Tropical plants and pink flamingos create an Instagram-friendly backdrop while sipping on Champagne. Open daily from 5 PM to 1 AM, it offers stunning views of the city.
address: 1595/ 500 Sukhumvit Rd, พระโขนงเหนือ วัฒนา Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Cocoa XO
description_full: This cognac bar comes with an all-you-can-eat chocolate buffet in the sky. Located a floor below Cru Champagne and above Red Sky, you could spend an evening here just moving up and down the stairs hopping between the three skyhigh rooftop bars. The seating areas are placed by the edge and go around almost in a circle, so you’ll be able to take in the view and the breeze from anywhere you sit.
summary: A rooftop bar offers a unique all-you-can-eat chocolate buffet paired with fine cognac. Seating wraps around the space, providing stunning views and a refreshing breeze. Perfect for an indulgent evening, guests can easily explore nearby bars in the same area.
address: 999, 99 Rama I Rd, Khwaeng Pathum Wan, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10300, Thailand

name: Cooling Tower
description_full: Taking home a win at the BAD Awards for their happy hour, Carlton Hotel’s rooftop bar sits on the  Road where you can sit back and escape the unusually long Asoke intersection traffic light down below while taking in the view. They offer happy hours every day from 5-6:30pm and the menu is two-pages long for buy-one-get-one from cocktail to wine to beer.
summary: A rooftop bar at the Carlton Hotel offers a relaxing escape from the bustling city below. Happy hour specials feature a diverse two-page menu with buy-one-get-one deals on cocktails, wine, and beer. With stunning views and a cozy atmosphere, it's perfect for unwinding after a long day.
address: 34th floor, Carlton Hotel Bangkok Sukhumvit 491 Sukhumvit Road Klongtoey Nua, 491 ถ. สุขุมวิท แขวงคลองเตยเหนือ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Cru Champagne
description_full: The bar is located on what used to be a helicopter landing pad on top of the five-star hotel Centara Grand at CentralWorld. Access Cru from a little elevator at Red Sky, which drops you right on top of the hotel, where you get a stunning, 59th-floor, 360-degree view of Bangkok. The drinks list is all about Champagne, so come prepared to order a bottle of G.H. Mumm Cordon Rouge Brut.
summary: Set atop a luxury hotel, this bar offers breathtaking 360-degree views of Bangkok from the 59th floor. Specializing in Champagne, guests can indulge in bottles like G.H. Mumm Cordon Rouge Brut while enjoying the chic ambiance. Access is via a discreet elevator, making it a unique spot for an upscale night out.
address: Centara Grand at CentralWorld, 999/99 Rama 1 road,, Phatumwan, เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand

name: Escape
description_full: The Swanky EmQuartier dedicates some fifth-floor, mall-top space to a venue that’s part tapas bar, part tiki bar, and wholly committed to its “downtown beach club” theme. Instagram-ready nooks litter the huge, tropical-plant and pink-flamingo festooned area.  The EmQuartier,  Arkapat,         11, .  daily 5pm-1am.
summary: A vibrant beach club vibe fills this fifth-floor bar, blending tapas and tiki offerings. Instagram-ready spots adorned with tropical plants create a lively atmosphere for socializing. Open daily from 5 PM to 1 AM, it's perfect for unwinding after shopping.
address: 693-695 5th Floor, Building B, EmQuartier Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Flamenco
description_full: A finalist for the Best Nightclub at this year’s BAD Awards, you know this sky bar can party. Sure, you’ll be indoors mostly, but the view’s the thing. You’ll find Latin themed designs and drinks, but the thing to keep in mind with Flamenco is that they are always—always—bringing in banging tunes from DJs around the city and the world. Sure, it’s on the hi-so side, but they know how to lean into the party vibes.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar with stunning views, this venue thrives on its lively atmosphere and Latin-inspired decor. Specialty cocktails complement a lineup of energetic DJs, ensuring the dance floor remains packed. Perfect for those seeking a high-energy night out in the city.
address: 9th Floor, Building A, Em Quartier, แขวงคลองตันเหนือ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Frankie’s Rooftop
description_full: This spot opened quietly last year, and it’s a pretty tiny venue. But you’ve got to give it up for Frankie’s because they’ve been bringing mad house tunes every week with big crowds and bigger parties. It may be small compared to some of these whopping great hotel rooftops, but they’re serving up European food that will fuel your dancing.
summary: A vibrant rooftop venue, Frankie’s Rooftop delivers energetic house music and lively parties. The menu highlights European dishes, perfect for fueling a night of dancing. With its intimate setting, it offers a unique vibe compared to larger hotel rooftops.
address: เลขที่44/5, 44/6 ซอยอรรคพัฒน์, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Invitation Only
description_full: We’re maybe stretching the definition as the inside is really the treat at Invitation Only, but it’s worth it for the sky-high view.  last year at Empire Tower all the way up to the 55th Floor, the team from Cassette Music Bar set up Invitation Only, a bar that comes with a panoramic sunset view and nostalgic cocktails from homemade ingredients. Contrary to typical small portion bar grubs, Invitation Only takes their food menu seriously with piri piri chicken skewers to lamb chop chimichurri to fuel you through the night.
summary: A rooftop bar on the 55th floor offers panoramic sunset views along with nostalgic cocktails crafted from homemade ingredients. Food options include hearty dishes like piri piri chicken skewers and lamb chop chimichurri, perfect for an evening out. Ideal for enjoying a relaxed atmosphere while soaking in the city skyline.
address: 55FL, Empire Tower, 1 S Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Yan Nawa, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Japan-ish
description_full: The outdoor rooftop area of this bar is not the most memorable on this list, but this spot is bringing fresh bites and fun events to Bangkok’s skies. The space, Japan-ish, blends Spanish restaurant elements with upscale izakaya vibes. Headed by Chef Jesus Pascual from the 3-star Michelin restaurant Arzak in Spain, the venue’s menu will feature robata grilling, sushi, sashimi, and large sharing plates.
summary: A rooftop bar in Bangkok combines Spanish and izakaya influences, offering a unique dining experience. Specialties include robata grilling, sushi, sashimi, and large sharing plates crafted by Michelin-starred Chef Jesus Pascual. The venue hosts fun events and provides great city views for a vibrant atmosphere.
address: 155 23-24 Soi Sukhumvit 11, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Lamaya Bangkok
description_full: This rooftop bar sits on the  11 and offers a 360-degree view. They offer a longer happy hour promotion than usual (four hours instead of the usual two), and drinks vary depending on the day.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar on the 30th floor offers stunning 360-degree views of Bangkok. Specializing in cocktails, the venue features an extended happy hour with varying drink options each day. Perfect for sunset gatherings, the atmosphere is lively and inviting.
address: 89, Floor 30, Staybridge Suites Bangkok Sukhumvit, 8 ซ.สุขุมวิท 24 แขวงคลองตัน เขตคลองเตย กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: The Loft
description_full: This rooftop bar sits on the  11 and offers a 360-degree view. They offer a longer happy hour promotion than usual (four hours instead of the usual two), and drinks vary depending on the day.
summary: A rooftop bar on the 56th floor offers stunning 360-degree views of the city. Specializing in a diverse drink menu with extended happy hours, it creates a relaxed atmosphere perfect for unwinding. Enjoy the unique experience of sipping cocktails while soaking in breathtaking vistas.
address: 56th Floor, 151 Thanon Ratchadamri, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Luz
description_full: On Nut isn’t the first place you think of when you hear “rooftop restaurant.” But that’s changing. Sitting on the  by Melia, Luz Tapas Bar is the brainchild of Chef de Cuisine Laia Ferrer, bringing her Barcelona heritage to life through Thai ingredients and Spanish flavors. The venue, which opened mid-September in 2023, offers two spacious areas: the Luz terrace and the Luz rooftop.
summary: A rooftop bar in On Nut, this venue combines Thai ingredients with Spanish tapas, reflecting Chef Laia Ferrer's Barcelona roots. Spacious areas include the terrace and rooftop, both offering stunning views. Perfect for a relaxed evening, happy hour adds to the inviting atmosphere.
address: INNSiDE by Melia 1472 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Nest Rooftop Lounge
description_full: This rooftop bar sits on the  11 and offers a 360-degree view. They offer a longer happy hour promotion than usual (four hours instead of the usual two), and drinks vary depending on the day.
summary: A stylish rooftop bar on the 11th floor offers stunning 360-degree views. Known for an extended happy hour, patrons can enjoy a rotating selection of drinks throughout the week. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for unwinding with friends or enjoying a romantic evening.
address: 11 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Octave
description_full: A rooftop bar with the added bonus of being right by Thonglor, this place is our favorite diversion for out-of-town friends when they start mumbling “skybar.” Cocktails don’t come quite at street-level prices, but you do get a stunning view of downtown Sukhumvit, coupled with an upbeat crowd of tourists. ​​​​​​ Marriott Hotel Sukhumvit,   33/1, 095 795 1841.  daily 7am-late.  Paradise LostParadise Lost brings tropical vibes to a district sorely lacking good nightlife venues. Recalling 1960s Miami, the lower floor is completely awash in candy pink and dotted with lush green plants. We recommend grabbing one of the circular, sunset-facing booths or daybeds to enjoy a refreshing cocktail.  Siam@Siam Design Hotel, 865 Rama 1 Rd., .  daily 5pm-1am.
summary: A rooftop bar with stunning views of downtown Sukhumvit invites an upbeat crowd to enjoy crafted cocktails. Perfect for socializing, this venue offers a lively atmosphere ideal for both tourists and locals alike. Open daily, it’s a great spot to unwind after exploring the vibrant Thonglor area.
address: 2 ซอย, Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: O’Shea’s Rooftop Bar and BBQ
description_full: Okay, okay. We’ve got plenty of hi-so spots for sipping cocktails and taking in the view and plenty more for DJs and parties. But this one’s for the pub crowd. Sports, local bands, cheap beer—what else do you need? You’ll find ample park bench style seating, and the stage gears up for some killer local acts.  33/1, 095 795 1841.  daily 7am-late.
summary: A laid-back rooftop bar caters to sports fans and music lovers alike, showcasing local bands while offering affordable drinks. Ample park bench seating creates a communal vibe perfect for enjoying the sunset. Open daily from morning until late, it invites guests to unwind in a friendly atmosphere.
address: 595, 16-19 Soi Sukhumvit 33/1, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Paradise Lost
description_full: Paradise Lost brings tropical vibes to a district sorely lacking good nightlife venues. Recalling 1960s Miami, the lower floor is completely awash in candy pink and dotted with lush green plants. We recommend grabbing one of the circular, sunset-facing booths or daybeds to enjoy a refreshing cocktail.
summary: A vibrant bar infused with tropical vibes, perfect for those seeking a lively night out. The lower floor features playful pink decor and lush greenery, inviting guests to relax in sunset-facing booths. Refreshing cocktails are a highlight, making it an ideal spot for a casual gathering.
address: 865 Rama I Rd, Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Red Sky
description_full: Bar.YardBar.Yard should be no stranger to folks who know Bangkok’s nightlife scene or fans of rooftop bars. This is the third year in a row the venue has earned the top spot from the BAD Awards voting panel in the rooftop bar category, and that’s largely because the venue keeps refining its best-in-class formula. This year, it launched an all-new line-up of weekly parties called “Nights at the Yard”, creating a good mixture of vibes and energy levels here with everything from ladies nights to more off-the-cuff parties and cosmopolitan dance-offs. Combine that with the already good food and drink and you have a home run yet again.  Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok, Soi Ton Son,  Salak Hin,  Rd., .  daily 6pm-late. Anju Korean Rooftop Bar Anju Korean Rooftop Bar is Bangkok's first and tallest Korean rooftop bar. Located on the 31st floor of the Sindhorn Midtown Hotel Bangkok, this spot offers panoramic views of Bangkok's cityscape. The bar plays true K-pop music for  K-pop fans, and the menu includes Korean comfort foods such as cheese tteobokki, shrimp ramyun, sizzling hot stir-fried baby octopus, and fried chicken. Drinks include distinctive cocktails made with Korean spirits and infusions of savory ingredients. “Anju” means “food eaten with alcohol," and it doesn't disappoint.   Sindhorn Midtown Hotel Bangkok, 68 Langusan, .  daily 5pm-late. Seen Restaurant and BarSeen does rooftop dining and drinking in style, occupying the top of Avani+ Riverside Bangkok Hotel for those of you willing to cross the river for your views.. This rooftop restaurant and bar floats high above the Chaophraya and serves international fusion cuisine and innovative cocktails from award-winning chefs and bartenders. For food, try the Black Angus beef cheek or the grilled maine lobster spaghetti. For drinks, there's the Asmodeus, which features durian sous vide with Bacardi Ocho rum, and the Satan, which is spicy from Tabasco but fruity from pineapple and mango. The rooftop spans two stories, with the 26th floor serving as an indoor-outdoor restaurant and lounge, and the 27th floor features an open-air rooftop bar. 26- Avani+ Riverside Bangkok Hotel, 257, Charoennakorn Rd., .  daily 11am-late.  ABar Rooftop
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar in Bangkok, this venue is known for its lively atmosphere and themed weekly parties. Specializing in a mix of international fusion cuisine and innovative cocktails, it offers stunning city views that enhance the experience. Open late daily, it's perfect for those looking to unwind with good food and drinks while enjoying the skyline.
address: 999, 99 Rama I Rd, Khwaeng Pathum Wan, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Scarlett Wine Bar & Restaurant
description_full: Perched 37 floors above Silom with river views to boot, this wine bistro combines well-executed French comfort food, chargrilled Aussie steaks and a long, long wine list into one sleek yet affordable package. The charcuterie and cheese platters also come highly recommended—just be sure to book well ahead for a spot on the terrace.
summary: Perched high above Silom, a sleek atmosphere invites guests to enjoy French comfort food and chargrilled steaks paired with an extensive wine list. Charcuterie and cheese platters are highlights, perfect for sharing. Reservations are recommended for the terrace to soak in the river views.
address: 188 Si Lom Rd, Khwaeng Suriya Wong, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: SIN Rooftop Bar
description_full: Also a finalist for this year’s BAD Awards for Best New Bar Design, SIN is the party lover’s new cocktail space for club kids who really like to do it up, complete with a gigantic glowing DJ booth. The music will have you moving, the cocktails are on point, and the views here are some of the best on the river. And, yes, it can also just be a spot for hanging out and having some food with a view.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar attracts party lovers with a stunning DJ booth and lively music. Cocktails are expertly crafted, complementing the breathtaking river views. Ideal for both dancing the night away or enjoying relaxed bites in an upscale setting.
address: Avani+ Riverside Bangkok Hotel, 257 Charoen Nakhon Rd, Khwaeng Samre, Khet Thon Buri, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10600, Thailand

name: Siwilai City Club
description_full: Commanding Bangkok's skyline from the 78th floor of the iconic Mahanakhon building (the second tallest building in Bangkok), Sky Beach (the city’s highest rooftop bar) takes rooftop experiences to dizzying new heights. Forget run-of-the-mill skyline selfies; here, jaw-dropping 360-degree panoramas can take the breath away. Indulge in creative cocktails and beverages alongside delectable sweet and savory treats as you soak in Bangkok’s vibrant energy. There’s also the occasional live entertainment adding an extra spark. The Standard, Bangkok Mahanakhon, 114 Naradhiwas Rajanagarindra Rd., Silom, Bang Rak, .  daily, 10am-midnight.
summary: Perched high above Bangkok, the rooftop bar offers stunning 360-degree views of the city skyline. Creative cocktails and a selection of sweet and savory bites enhance the vibrant atmosphere, complemented by occasional live entertainment. Perfect for enjoying a night out under the stars, this venue captures the city's energy beautifully.
address: Level 5, Central Embassy, 1031 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Sky Beach
description_full: Commanding Bangkok's skyline from the 78th floor of the iconic Mahanakhon building (the second tallest building in Bangkok), Sky Beach (the city’s highest rooftop bar) takes rooftop experiences to dizzying new heights. Forget run-of-the-mill skyline selfies; here, jaw-dropping 360-degree panoramas can take the breath away. Indulge in creative cocktails and beverages alongside delectable sweet and savory treats as you soak in Bangkok’s vibrant energy. There’s also the occasional live entertainment adding an extra spark. The Standard, Bangkok Mahanakhon, 114 Naradhiwas Rajanagarindra Rd., Silom, Bang Rak, .  daily, 10am-midnight.
summary: Commanding stunning views from the 78th floor, a rooftop bar offers creative cocktails and delicious bites in a vibrant atmosphere. Guests can enjoy breathtaking 360-degree panoramas while soaking up the city's energy. Live entertainment occasionally enhances the experience.
address: The Standard, Bangkok Mahanakhon, 78th Floor, 114 ถนน นราธิวาสราชนครินทร์ แขวงสีลม เขตบางรัก กรุงเทพมหานคร 10500, Thailand

name: Sky On 20
description_full: Maybe the most chilled out—and definitely the best value—rooftop bar in the city, this is the kind of place we wish could remain a secret. Here you can expect legitimately affordable cocktails on a rooftop that are actually good, plus a low-key house soundtrack and room to breathe.
summary: A relaxed rooftop bar offers affordable cocktails with a chill vibe and a low-key house soundtrack. Set on the 26th floor, it provides ample space to unwind while enjoying city views. Perfect for casual meetups or late-night hangs.
address: 26th floor, Novotel Bangkok, 19/9 Soi Sukhumvit 20, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: The Speakeasy
description_full: This rooftop cocktail lounge takes you back to the jazz age. The two-story space sports prohibition era-inspired decor, featuring lots of dark woods and Art Deco touches. A balcony on the 24th floor lets you take in 180-degree views of Bangkok’s business district, while an alfresco rooftop offers a more leisurely atmosphere. 24- Hotel Muse Bangkok Langsuan, 55/555 Lang Suan Rd., .  daily 6pm-1am.
summary: A rooftop cocktail lounge with a jazz age vibe, featuring dark woods and Art Deco decor. Enjoy 180-degree views of Bangkok’s skyline from the 24th-floor balcony or unwind on the alfresco rooftop. Perfect for evening relaxation, the space comes alive with expertly crafted cocktails.
address: 55, 555 Lang Suan Rd, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Spectrum Lounge & Bar
description_full: Spread over three levels and 280 sqm, Spectrum can accommodate almost 300 people. The inviting indoor living room comes with a sky blue velvet carpet, a glowing gold fretwork ceiling, a black marble bar and Thai artwork. Their drink promotion of two-hour free-flow house wine for B999 is a steal.
summary: A stylish bar spread over three levels, Spectrum features a chic indoor living room with a striking gold ceiling and black marble bar. Specializing in house wines, the two-hour free-flow promotion offers great value for social gatherings. The vibrant atmosphere makes it an ideal spot for unwinding after a long day.
address: Hyatt Regency Bangkok, 1 Soi Sukhumvit 13, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Starlight Rooftop Bar
description_full: only a few months ago atop the Mercure Hotel, Starlight Rooftop Bar is a 60-square-meter rooftop bar smack dab in the middle of Surawong. While you’ll definitely want to keep your eye on the sky, this venue does have an indoor area, Yu Her Bao is cooking up in the kitchen and Gongson Sonti is behind the bar.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar atop the Mercure Hotel offers stunning views of the city skyline. Specialty cocktails crafted by Gongson Sonti pair perfectly with dishes from Yu Her Bao's kitchen. Perfect for a night out, the space combines an indoor area with an open-air vibe.
address: R Floor, 222 Surawong Rd, Khwaeng Si Phraya, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Tichuca
description_full: Tichuca is a fun, multi-level rooftop bar with a jungle décor inspired by South Africa. The bar provides an escape into lush foliage and tropical feels. There are three levels decked out with wooden furniture, rattan chairs, flora, and a massive LED-lit tree that sways behind the bar. Indulge in a menu of signature tiki drinks like the Pineapple Mule or Vietnamese Guava, and you can expect huge line-ups as the night unfolds. For the ultimate experience, we recommend arriving around opening for the sunset.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar offers a lush jungle-inspired escape with multiple levels of tropical décor. Signature tiki drinks like the Pineapple Mule provide a unique twist, drawing lively crowds as night falls. Arriving early is recommended for stunning sunset views over the city.
address: ตึก ที วัน ชั้น 46, Soi Sukhumvit 40, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Tribe
description_full: Tribe Sky Beach Club is a stylish tropical beach oasis and Bangkok’s only sky beach club. Doors open at 11am, and guests can enjoy a day party or a swim in the sprawling pool spilling over Bangkok’s skyline. Don’t worry if you forgot your swimwear. They have swimsuits and complimentary towels available. The pool area includes day beds and a swim-up bar.
summary: A stylish tropical beach oasis, this sky beach club offers a vibrant atmosphere with stunning views of Bangkok's skyline. Guests can enjoy day parties, relax on day beds, or take a dip in the expansive pool, complete with a swim-up bar. With complimentary swimsuits and towels available, comfort is prioritized for all visitors.
address: 122 Soi Sukhumvit 39, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Tulum Sky Bar
description_full: Drawing inspiration from the coastal town of Tulum, also known as the summer haven for the elite. Tulum Sky Bar stands as Bangkok’s jungle rooftop bar, located on the 29th floor of Movenpick Ekkamai. The expansive rooftop bar pays homage to the Mexican Caribbean, featuring sculptures reminiscent of the Mayans and adorned with Aztec patterns on the walls, thatched light fixtures, and hanging vines. For entertainment there’s DJs spinning tropical tracks and jungle style performances featuring pole dancing, Latin moves and fire shows. Drinks are mostly tequila based, like the Aztec Fire Potion that’s fired up with tabasco to compliment the tequila and milk punch. For something lighter, try the fruity Cenote Caramel Splash with Jose Cuervo, pineapple, passionfruit, and salted caramel.
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar on the 29th floor, this venue captures the essence of Tulum with its jungle-inspired decor and tropical ambiance. Specialty tequila drinks like the Aztec Fire Potion add a unique twist to the experience, complemented by lively DJ sets and captivating performances. Perfect for a night out, the atmosphere is electric yet relaxed, inviting guests to unwind under the stars.
address: 559 Soi Sukhumvit 63, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Vanilla Sky Rooftop
description_full: Decked out with LED lights, Vanilla Sky gives off a fancy sky bar atmosphere but remains easy-going. Gin and tonics take a starring role in the cocktail menu, with some unusual flavors in the mix—think peppermint and passionfruit or chestnut and chamomile. While here, be sure to visit sister bar Mojjo, which serves rum-heavy drinks amid a Cuban theme a few floors below.
summary: A stylish rooftop bar with a relaxed ambiance, Vanilla Sky features inventive gin and tonics that include unique flavors like peppermint and passionfruit. LED lights enhance the chic atmosphere, making it an inviting spot for evening cocktails. For those seeking more variety, the nearby Mojjo offers a vibrant Cuban-themed rum experience on a lower floor.
address: 35th Floor SKYVIEW Hotel Bangkok 12 Soi Sukhumvit 24, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Vertigo and Moon Bar
description_full: Legendary for its heart-stopping 61-story views of the scattered city lights, Moon Bar was one of the first rooftop places in town and it’s still hard to beat the vertiginous 360-degree views offered up by this small al fresco bar atop the Banyan Tree Hotel. If you can stomach the feeling that you're at a tourist trap (and the accompanying prices), the views are indeed spectacular.
summary: A stunning rooftop bar offering breathtaking 360-degree views of the city skyline, perfect for a memorable evening. Specialty cocktails and a chic atmosphere attract both locals and tourists alike. Enjoy the vibrant ambiance as you sip drinks under the stars.
address: 21/100 S Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Wallflowers Upstairs
description_full: You’ll feel like you’re entering the secret garden as you ascend the creaky wooden staircase that leads to this rustic rooftop bar. Through a maze of hanging plants, flower tube chandeliers, exposed brick walls, fairy lights, and wooden ladders, you’ll be met with international dishes and Garden of Eden-themed cocktails. Rooftop/F, Oneday Wallflowers,  Nana, .  Thu-Sun 6pm-midnight.
summary: A rustic rooftop bar invites guests to explore its enchanting atmosphere filled with hanging plants and fairy lights. Specialties include international dishes paired with unique Garden of Eden-themed cocktails. Open late from Thursday to Sunday, it’s perfect for a cozy evening under the stars.
address: 37 39-41 Soi Ram Maitri, Khwaeng Pom Prap, Khet Pom Prap Sattru Phai, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand

name: Yao Rooftop Bar
description_full: Bar.YardBar.Yard should be no stranger to folks who know Bangkok’s nightlife scene or fans of rooftop bars. This is the third year in a row the venue has earned the top spot from the BAD Awards voting panel in the rooftop bar category, and that’s largely because the venue keeps refining its best-in-class formula. This year, it launched an all-new line-up of weekly parties called “Nights at the Yard”, creating a good mixture of vibes and energy levels here with everything from ladies nights to more off-the-cuff parties and cosmopolitan dance-offs. Combine that with the already good food and drink and you have a home run yet again.  Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok, Soi Ton Son,  Salak Hin,  Rd., .  daily 6pm-late. Anju Korean Rooftop Bar Anju Korean Rooftop Bar is Bangkok's first and tallest Korean rooftop bar. Located on the 31st floor of the Sindhorn Midtown Hotel Bangkok, this spot offers panoramic views of Bangkok's cityscape. The bar plays true K-pop music for  K-pop fans, and the menu includes Korean comfort foods such as cheese tteobokki, shrimp ramyun, sizzling hot stir-fried baby octopus, and fried chicken. Drinks include distinctive cocktails made with Korean spirits and infusions of savory ingredients. “Anju” means “food eaten with alcohol," and it doesn't disappoint.   Sindhorn Midtown Hotel Bangkok, 68 Langusan, .  daily 5pm-late. Seen Restaurant and BarSeen does rooftop dining and drinking in style, occupying the top of Avani+ Riverside Bangkok Hotel for those of you willing to cross the river for your views.. This rooftop restaurant and bar floats high above the Chaophraya and serves international fusion cuisine and innovative cocktails from award-winning chefs and bartenders. For food, try the Black Angus beef cheek or the grilled maine lobster spaghetti. For drinks, there's the Asmodeus, which features durian sous vide with Bacardi Ocho rum, and the Satan, which is spicy from Tabasco but fruity from pineapple and mango. The rooftop spans two stories, with the 26th floor serving as an indoor-outdoor restaurant and lounge, and the 27th floor features an open-air rooftop bar. 26- Avani+ Riverside Bangkok Hotel, 257, Charoennakorn Rd., .  daily 11am-late.  ABar Rooftop
summary: A vibrant rooftop bar known for its lively atmosphere, this venue features an exciting lineup of themed parties throughout the week. Specialty cocktails and a diverse menu pair well with stunning views of Bangkok's skyline. Perfect for socializing, the space buzzes with energy, making it a great spot for both locals and visitors.
address: Rooftop of Bangkok Marriott Hotel The Surawongse 262 Surawong Rd, 262 ถ. สุรวงศ์ แขวงสี่พระยา เขตบางรัก กรุงเทพมหานคร 10500, Thailand

description_full:

View More New Places
summary: A lively bar that invites socializing with a creative cocktail menu. Open all day Sunday, the atmosphere is perfect for unwinding or gathering with friends. Unique drinks and a friendly vibe make it a local favorite.
address: 48 Thanon Ratchadaphisek, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Back to top
description_full: For fans of Bangkok cafes, Sarnies needs no introduction. Their Sukhumvit spot is still relatively new and they’re drawing early crowds who want that special Sarnies brew and a sit-down bite. You can expect a slate of the usual comfort breakfast options like miso kombu eggs Benedict served with aburi smoked salmon, sautéed leeks and shichimi togarashi (B400); or the sourdough pancakes served with apple miso caramel and house-made granola (B350).
summary: A cozy bar in Sukhumvit, this venue specializes in comfort breakfasts and unique coffee brews. Menu highlights include miso kombu eggs Benedict and sourdough pancakes with apple miso caramel. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for a relaxed meal any time of day.
address: เลขที่ 7 Soi Sukhumvit 20, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Progress Cafe
description_full: Hidden inside Ari Story hostel, Progress Cafe is the cafe-by-day-and-bar-by-night to know. Those who enjoy fruity coffee can try the Black Yuzu (B120) which is a cold brew with house made yuzu syrup and lime. And get yourself a square of their gooey chocolate brownie (B50) to add some sweetness to your morning. But if you’re more of a smoothie person, their new tropical blend (B135) will give you some pina colada flavor sans alcohol.
summary: A hidden gem inside a hostel, this café transforms into a bar after dark. Fruity coffee lovers will appreciate the Black Yuzu cold brew, while smoothie enthusiasts can enjoy the tropical blend. The cozy atmosphere and sweet treats like gooey brownies create a welcoming vibe for all.
address: 2, 7 ชั้น 2 Soi Ari 1, Phaya Thai, Khet Phaya Thai, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand

name: Lucky’s Hungry AFR
description_full: From a successful online biz to a full fledged storefront, Lucky’s Hungry AFR takes the simple concept of American fried rice and elevates it to the next level. The Chicken Supreme AFR (B319) tops your fried rice with french style chicken confit, bits of smoked ham, bacon, Italian cheese sausage, and fried egg. Take the American theme to another level with some PB&J milkshake that will certainly boost your blood sugar levels. Adding a bit of greens, we tried out the watermelon cheese salad (B195) which tosses some rocket with some feta and dried fish.
summary: A vibrant eatery transforms American fried rice into a gourmet experience with unique toppings like chicken confit and smoked ham. Specialty shakes and fresh salads add to the diverse menu, making it a lively spot for comfort food lovers. The casual atmosphere invites both quick bites and relaxed meals.
address: 991/1 Rama I Rd, Khwaeng Pathum Wan, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Kopi Hub Prime Ari
description_full: Taking the dimsum experience to new heights, Kopi Hub Prime Ari doesn’t limit your porridge and xiaomi to regular ingredients; they add to the experience with fancy produce like ikura and truffles. Their patongko (B50) is deep fried and grilled to get that extra crunchiness and fluffy interior. The joint is also famous for their Bak Kuh Teh (B249) and fried tarot which comes in four flavors: seafood curry, red pork, pork curry and truffles.
summary: A trendy spot in Ari, this restaurant elevates dim sum with luxurious ingredients like ikura and truffles. Known for its crunchy patongko and flavorful Bak Kuh Teh, the menu offers unique twists on traditional dishes. Perfect for food enthusiasts, each dish is crafted to deliver an exceptional dining experience.
address: 31, 1 Soi Ari 2, Phaya Thai, Khet Phaya Thai, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand

name: Sanan bakery
description_full: What started as a family recipe has been passed down for generations. Sanan Bakery specializes in the kind of homey baked pastries that you’d grab and go before school or work. Their signature is the cone cream (B45) is a pie filled with delightful custard cream. But this year’s best seller has got to go to the shio pan ham cheese tucked in a salted butter roll and four kinds of cheese. Since it's in high demand, we recommend booking at least 2-3 hours in advance.
summary: A family-run bakery offers a cozy vibe with homey pastries perfect for on-the-go snacks. Known for their cone cream filled with custard and the popular shio pan ham cheese, this spot attracts locals looking for quality treats. Advance booking is advised due to high demand.
address: 101 Phahon Yothin Road, Khwaeng Lat Yao, Khet Chatuchak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10900, Thailand

name: Eggtisan
description_full: This vibrant red restaurant, led by the owners of the Common Room x Ari, is reserved for the real egg master who wants to create every imaginable variant of egg-based dishes in Ari. Try the runny eggs sandwich (B195) or the scrambled eggs (B170) served with smoked salmon bread. The coffee at this location is of a very high standard; basic beverages cost B90, while specialty drinks like espresso with milk cream cost B120.
summary: A vibrant red restaurant, egg enthusiasts will find a wide array of egg-based dishes crafted with care. Specialties include the runny eggs sandwich and scrambled eggs paired with smoked salmon bread. High-quality coffee complements the menu, making it a great spot for brunch or a casual meeting.
address: 33 Rajchakru Ave, room 106, ซ. พหลโยธิน 5 แขวงพญาไท เขตพญาไท กรุงเทพมหานคร 10400, Thailand

name: Libi Home NEW
description_full: Walk inside the Kasemsarn Soi  (B215) serving Northern Thai curry noodles with grilled chicken, but if you think that might be a bit too hard for breakfast, try the Libi pork noodle soup (B165) to warm you up—or just pop in for an espresso or coconut juice.
summary: A casual spot on Kasemsarn Soi, the menu features Northern Thai curry noodles and comforting pork noodle soup. Perfect for a quick breakfast or a refreshing espresso, the atmosphere invites relaxed dining. Grilled chicken adds a delicious twist to traditional flavors.
address: เลขที่ 9 Soi Kasem San 2, Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Eggdrop
description_full: Featuring their famous premium fluffy egg sandwiches from Korea, Eggdrop Bangkok’s store has shiny chrome accents and a red-and-white color scheme reminiscent of an American diner. The store takes orders via kiosks, and we suggest the Mr Egg (B89), which is crunchy brioche, fluffy scrambled egg, and sriracha mayo. For something more filling, try the garlic bacon cheese (B129); the smell of the toasted garlic brioche alone will have you drooling.
summary: A vibrant eatery with a retro American diner vibe, this spot specializes in fluffy egg sandwiches inspired by Korean flavors. Highlights include the crunchy brioche Mr Egg and the aromatic garlic bacon cheese, perfect for satisfying cravings. Kiosks streamline ordering, enhancing the casual dining experience.
address: Floor 1 Centerpoint Siam Square 292 Rama I Rd, Patumwan Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Hia Buay
description_full: This modest shop serving up cheap food for nearly a quarter of a century got a boost from politicians last year, notably After Move Forward Party's Pita Limjaroenrat. Well, a lot has changed since then, but here the yentafo (Thai pink noodle soup), dry rice porridge, and braised pork kaprao are crowd-pleasers. Hia Buay also prepares dry meals for takeout, which are wrapped in traditional banana leaves to enhance the dish's natural scent. Best of all, the restaurant is noted for its enormous portions and reasonable prices (B60-120).
summary: A modest shop serving affordable Thai comfort food, yentafo and braised pork kaprao are popular choices. Dry meals wrapped in banana leaves add a unique touch to the takeout experience. With generous portions and reasonable prices, this spot is perfect for satisfying cravings.
address: 10 2 Soi Polo, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Cilantro
description_full: At the GalileOasis art space, Cilantro is a chic restaurant for enjoying theater and art in the same area. The whole venue is a renovated building, turning into an oasis for people to connect. Here at Cilantro you can enjoy the turkey and emmental sandwich, serving a turkey breast with emmental cheese, and dijonaise sauce on toast (B110). Taste a little spice with the Sriracha chicken, a chicken smothered in sriracha-mayo sauce with cheddar cheese in panini bread (B115), and conclude with the Spanish latte for B90.
summary: A chic restaurant within the GalileOasis art space invites guests to savor delicious sandwiches and specialty coffee. Highlights include the turkey and emmental sandwich and Sriracha chicken panini, perfect for a casual meal. The vibrant atmosphere fosters connection among art lovers and food enthusiasts alike.
address: 535/32 ตึก D ห้องเลขที่ 414, 415 Banthat Thong Rd, Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand

name: Stockroom
description_full: Not to be confused with the Stock.Room, this cafe has a touch of minimalism and is found deep inside Ratchathewi. Offering a breakfast and brunch menu as well as tasty desserts, the venue has a modern design and a good vibe for work and chat. The truffle cream toast (B250) is served with sourdough toast with truffle cream, parmesan, rocket Sauteed champignon and shitake, and tomato; the signature almond tart (B180) comes with mascarpone whipped cream.
summary: A minimalistic café tucked away in Ratchathewi, this spot offers a serene atmosphere perfect for work or casual chats. The breakfast and brunch menu features highlights like truffle cream toast and signature almond tart. Modern design elements enhance the inviting vibe, making it a great place to unwind.
address: Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok, Soi Ton Son, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Toby’s
description_full: Toby’s serves up breakfast on Sukhumvit Soi 38, and in Saladaeng, but Ploenchit is in real need of some brekkie. The interiors are a little more corporate than the other locations, but they still have all the Toby’s grub you love. Start with the Egg Mikado serving two poached eggs on sourdough, house-cured salmon with orange hollandaise sauce (B320), or the breakfast bruschetta, a poached egg with tomato and avocado salsa, served with sourdough, bacon, feta, and soft herb salad (B295).
summary: A bright café on Sukhumvit Soi 38, breakfast options include the Egg Mikado and a flavorful breakfast bruschetta. The corporate-style interiors offer a comfortable setting for casual dining. Perfect for brunch lovers seeking quality dishes in a relaxed atmosphere.
address: 75 Soi Santi Suk, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Sokozy NEW
description_full: You can walk right in after getting down from the BTS Asoke. The venue is a Thai vintage house, and with its coziness and wooden decorating, Sokozy is a good place to start a day. Begin with the Asok Acai, a bowl served with signature acai, granola, banana, and mixed berries (B250) or the pacific bowl (spirulina blend, granola, dragon fruit, mango, and goji) and freshen up with coffee. Alternatively, you can order fresh baked butter croissants to eat with protein smoothies.
summary: A cozy Thai vintage house invites guests to enjoy a relaxed atmosphere. Start the day with signature acai bowls or fresh baked croissants paired with smoothies. Perfectly located near BTS Asoke, it’s an ideal spot for a refreshing morning break.
address: 3, 7 Soi Sukhumvit 18, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Tempered Cooperatives
description_full: two years ago, Tempered is Bangkok’s cacao obsessed cafe, all the chocolate dreams of a passionate couple. The space on Soi Ruamrudee 2 is a renovated five-storey office featuring creative baked goods. Opt for the new cheesy bacon roll on their new menu or just stop by for your morning joe. Their Chocolate Dirty (B225), you guessed it, is their famous hot chocolate topped with a strong espresso.
summary: A cacao-focused café tucked away in a renovated office, offering creative baked goods and rich chocolate treats. Specialty items like the cheesy bacon roll and the Chocolate Dirty hot chocolate with espresso delight visitors. Perfect for a morning coffee break or a sweet indulgence in Bangkok.
address: 59 อาคารพริม Soi Ruam Rudi 2, ลุมพินี Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: The Pablo NEW
description_full: The breakfast issue is a big deal to us at BK. You love it. We love it. And we do it every year. This year, we’re happy to introduce a host of new picks from hidden and cheap morning snacks from Myanmar to American-themed diners doing PB&J milkshakes. We’ve also got quite a few spaces that are open before 8am for you early risers. So, let’s wake up.
summary: A vibrant spot for breakfast enthusiasts, offering a diverse menu that ranges from Myanmar snacks to American diner classics. Early risers can enjoy space before 8am, making it perfect for morning gatherings. Unique selections like PB&J milkshakes add a fun twist to the experience.
address: 2 Soi Sukhumvit 25, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Iwane Goes Nature
description_full: since 2011, Iwane Goes Nature is still knocking out healthy breakfasts in Asoke. You can opt for the simple American breakfast (B165) of scrambled eggs with ham salad and toast or the Farmer Set, which features home fried potatoes with bacon and eggs (B135). It’s also a rare chance to get a little Korean breakfast (B165), here offering spicy Korean noodles with rice balls.
summary: A cozy spot in Asoke, healthy breakfasts shine with options like the Farmer Set featuring home-fried potatoes and bacon. Korean breakfast lovers can enjoy spicy noodles with rice balls, adding a unique twist. Open daily from morning until night, it's perfect for any brunch craving.
address: 14 Soi Sukhumvit 23, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Sarnies カフェ Sukhumvit
description_full: For fans of Bangkok cafes, Sarnies needs no introduction. Their Sukhumvit spot is still relatively new and they’re drawing early crowds who want that special Sarnies brew and a sit-down bite. You can expect a slate of the usual comfort breakfast options like miso kombu eggs Benedict served with aburi smoked salmon, sautéed leeks and shichimi togarashi (B400); or the sourdough pancakes served with apple miso caramel and house-made granola (B350).
summary: A cozy café in Sukhumvit, this spot offers a delightful range of comfort breakfast options. Specialty dishes like miso kombu eggs Benedict and sourdough pancakes highlight the menu. With its inviting atmosphere, it's perfect for enjoying a leisurely meal.
address: 1, 39 Soi Sukhumvit 37, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Luka Sukhumvit 31 NEW
description_full: For fans of Bangkok cafes, Sarnies needs no introduction. Their Sukhumvit spot is still relatively new and they’re drawing early crowds who want that special Sarnies brew and a sit-down bite. You can expect a slate of the usual comfort breakfast options like miso kombu eggs Benedict served with aburi smoked salmon, sautéed leeks and shichimi togarashi (B400); or the sourdough pancakes served with apple miso caramel and house-made granola (B350).
summary: A welcoming café in Sukhumvit, early risers can enjoy comfort breakfast options like miso kombu eggs Benedict and sourdough pancakes. Specialty brews complement the cozy atmosphere, perfect for a laid-back meal. The inviting space attracts both locals and visitors alike.
address: 29 ซ. สุขุมวิท 31 Klongtoey Nua, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Fest
description_full: Fest has had a shakeup of their menu in the last year, making it a good try for anyone not wanting to face that end of Soi 31 traffic. Found on the ground floor of the Public House hotel, they’re mixing it up by putting some western faves on the menu with some ingredients that pop—think bacon pancakes (B320) with grilled caramelised rum banana, folded breakfast pizza sandwich (B320). They also have some fun veggie options like their No-avacado toast featuring house-made green veggie dip with feta cloud and two poached eggs as well as the Tofu Scramble (B250) with spinach, mushrooms, no-avo guacamole, and harissa.
summary: A laid-back spot in the Public House hotel, this restaurant serves a creative menu blending Western favorites with unique ingredients. Bacon pancakes and veggie options like no-avocado toast showcase their playful approach to brunch. Open daily from morning to late night, it’s perfect for casual dining away from the hustle.
address: 249 ซ. สุขุมวิท 31 Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Chu
description_full: So many restaurants come and go, and Chu never dies. The eggs benedict with Sloan’s back bacon (B300) and the smashed avocado toast (B320) are favorites here. Those with a sweet tooth can enjoy their Belgian waffles (B240) topped with banana, chocolate chips, salted caramel whipped cream, and dark chocolate gelato.
summary: A casual dining spot known for its brunch offerings, featuring delightful eggs benedict and smashed avocado toast. Sweet options like Belgian waffles with decadent toppings provide a treat for dessert lovers. Open daily from morning until evening, the welcoming ambiance makes it perfect for any meal.
address: 18/1 ซ. สุขุมวิท 31 เเขวง คลองตันเหนือ, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: BKK Bagels (Soi 33)
description_full: It was a big win for the Sukhumvit when this spot came to Phrom Phong last year. It’s hard to find a better bagel joint in Bangkok, and now they’ve got a spot in Phrom Phong. Choose from a number of different kinds of bagels and schmear for B50. However, the Breakfast Epic with Bacon (B215) which also comes with gruyere, gouda, or cheddar cheese is our favorite breakfast item—that bacon is just insanely good. You can also add some plain bagels and schmear of your choice. If you want something a little higher end, try the Lock, Stock, and Bagel (B250), which has house-cured salmon.
summary: A cozy bagel shop in Phrom Phong, offering a range of delicious bagels and schmears. Breakfast favorites include the Epic with Bacon and the upscale Lock, Stock, and Bagel featuring house-cured salmon. Perfect for a casual morning bite or a quick lunch.
address: 27 1 Soi Sukhumvit 33, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Dos Burros NEW
description_full: Bangkok’s favorite Mexican food brothers, Itzco and Tlahui Calva, who have been dishing out the goodies at Missing Burro in Thonglor for years, have opened a new spot on the Southside of Thonglor, Dos Burros.
