This new space adds a little something special to their offerings on the other side of Thonglor—notably, breakfast, as they’re open at 8am. The breakfast menu includes the classic huevos rancheros with two sunny side up eggs and a tatemada sauce, as well as the huevos a la malagena featuring two poached eggs, shrimp, green peas, and corn tortillas.
summary: A vibrant spot in Thonglor, this restaurant specializes in authentic Mexican breakfast dishes like huevos rancheros and huevos a la malagena. Open early at 8am, it offers a cozy atmosphere perfect for morning gatherings. The location adds a unique twist to the well-loved offerings of its sister venue.
address: Sukhumvit 36, 2d Soi 23 7, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Caffè Olives
description_full: From the minds behind the unstoppably brilliant L’Olivia comes Caffe Olives, found at the same space. The all-day brunch fare here is good for an early breakfast too, with the likes of maple bacon sausage and eggs (B320) featuring greens, potatoes, and toasted focaccia or their Italian egg shakshuka (B320). If you’re there on the weekend, opt for the focaccia eggs Benedict (B350) with poached eggs, ham, and Hollandaise sauce. Coffees start at B390, and you can grab yourself a little brioche filled gelato for that morning sweet tooth (B220).
summary: A cozy spot for all-day brunch, this venue serves delicious options like Italian egg shakshuka and focaccia eggs Benedict. Specialty coffees and sweet brioche gelato add to the inviting experience. Perfect for a relaxed morning, the atmosphere feels warm and welcoming.
address: 4, 2 ซ สุขุมวิท 36 แขวงคลองตัน เขตคลองเตย กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Daisie May's Home Cafe
description_full: The word “quaint” comes to mind when thinking of this place. The food is your classic breakfast fare with a selection of dishes including croissants and very hearty full breakfasts. But it’s likely the cute design, outdoor seating, and family friendly area that will catch your attention—a bit like an English garden made for Ekkamai.
summary: A cozy café in Ekkamai offers classic breakfast dishes like croissants and hearty full breakfasts. Outdoor seating enhances the family-friendly vibe, reminiscent of an English garden. Cute design elements make it a charming spot to enjoy a relaxed meal.
address: 76, 5 Soi Ekkamai 22, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Rolling Roasters NEW
description_full: A new station from the Rolling Roasters crew (who are really into coffee) in the heart of downtown, this space gives the coffee bean lovers a space that looks more akin to a futuristic coffee lab than a cafe. And even though this is definitely a spot for the coffee nerds awake early, it’s also serving up some fun food items like their Big Brekkie (B300) and french toast (B250) with strawberries, blueberries, and bananas.
summary: A futuristic coffee lab vibe welcomes enthusiasts to explore specialty brews. Fun food options like the Big Brekkie and fruity french toast complement the caffeine experience. Perfect for early risers, this spot brings together quality coffee and casual dining.
address: 333 Soi Sutthiphong 1, Ratchadaphisek, Khet Din Daeng, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand

name: Gigi Ekkamai NEW
description_full: The beloved Gigi Dining Hall has opened another Italian restaurant and cafe, this time in Ekkamai. This new venture, which you may have seen already from the BTS, will have both fan favorites and new classics in store. For something sweet and classic, try the Dolce Pancakes (B250) with caramelized banana, honey, vanilla ice cream, and mascarpone or maybe the Nutella Croissant (B170). For something more savory there’s the Gigi Breakfast (B420) with in-house smoked salmon, eggs, Italian ham, avocado mash, and chickpea salad.
summary: A vibrant Italian café in Ekkamai, this spot serves both beloved classics and exciting new dishes. Indulge in sweet treats like Dolce Pancakes or savor a hearty Gigi Breakfast featuring in-house smoked salmon. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for any meal of the day.
address: 1239 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Kynd Kulture NEW
description_full: This one's for you vegans out there. Kynd Kulture is found on the quiet Ekkamai Soi six and is beloved of health nuts and Instagrammers alike. They have some sweet favorites like a Hokkaido banana toast, but for a big and very vegan breakfast, you can reach a little further for something like their Young Blood (B290) featuring avocado with edamame, quinoa, and kimchi, or their Beat Up (B260) with organic beetroot hummus with avocado feta cheese and avocado and more spread across sourdough bread.
summary: A cozy spot in Ekkamai, this restaurant celebrates vegan cuisine with colorful and nutritious dishes. Popular menu items include the Hokkaido banana toast and hearty breakfast options like Young Blood and Beat Up. Perfect for health-conscious diners and Instagram lovers alike, the ambiance is warm and inviting.
address: 26 Ekkamai 6 Alley, พระโขนงเหนือ Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Holey Mothership Bakery and Cafe
description_full: There are four Holey Bakery outlets around Bangkok, so why did we choose to include the branch in Phra Khanong. Frankly, it’s because the neighborhood really, really needs it. Now, let’s talk breakfast. First off, a big one for egg lovers is the three egg Pan Eggs (B400) with mushroom ragout and sauteed spinach alongside spinach and kale to put on your sourdough toast. And the breakfast pizza (B400) and Mighty Shakshuka (B400) are also must-trys. For sweets, you’re spoiled for choice with dozens of cookies, pastries, and cakes from this staple bakery.
summary: A cozy bakery in Phra Khanong offers a delightful breakfast menu featuring three-egg Pan Eggs and savory breakfast pizza. Sweet treats abound with an impressive selection of cookies, pastries, and cakes. Perfect for early risers, the inviting space encourages relaxed dining throughout the day.
address: 29 Soi Mi Suwan 3, Khwaeng Phra Khanong Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Pa Ma Heng The Eatery
description_full: Chic, homey, pet-friendly—Pa Ma Heng came on the scene last year with a large space, a cun vibe, and breakfast food everyone loves. From the outside, it looks like a large family home—not particularly ostentatious—but the menu is giant. For something a little unexpected, zhuzh up your normal Thai breakfast with the ka-prow Australian beef ribeye over rice (B485) or the ka-prow salmon (B535). You’ll also find a selection of waffles and sweets alongside the normal breakfast favorites like three different styles of eggs Benedict.
summary: A chic, homey eatery invites guests to enjoy a pet-friendly atmosphere with a diverse breakfast menu. Specialties include creative takes on Thai classics like the ka-prow beef ribeye and salmon, alongside delightful waffles. The spacious setting feels warm and welcoming, perfect for leisurely mornings.
address: 420 Sukhumvit 71 Rd, Khwaeng Phra Khanong Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Laxmi Celebrating of Myanmar Food
description_full: For the last few years, this has been a little Phra Khanong secret, serving up Myanmar fare—and where else can you get mohinga noodles at 6am? On the breakfast menu, you’ll find extremely affordable bites like the Shan noodles for just B50 and bean fried rice for just B60. And, if you really want to start your morning off with a bang, they’ve got a breakfast mala curry (B120) that will wake you up.
summary: A hidden gem in Phra Khanong, this restaurant specializes in authentic Myanmar dishes served from early morning. Breakfast highlights include mohinga noodles and Shan noodles at incredibly low prices, perfect for a quick bite. The vibrant atmosphere invites locals and adventurous eaters alike to experience unique flavors any day of the week.
address: 930, 4 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Nicolo Bakery
description_full: It’s a chill, pet-friendly shophouse bakery between Ekkamai and Phra Khanong that’s a perfect spot for early morning dog walkers. They’ve got a wide range of fresh breads to try daily, but the real treats here are sweet and affordable. You can snaffle up a moist brownie here for just B95 and three Petite Madeleines for B55. The space is big enough and stylish enough to relax—and you won’t miss their signage.
summary: A chill, pet-friendly bakery nestled between Ekkamai and Phra Khanong welcomes early morning dog walkers. Fresh breads and affordable sweets like moist brownies and Petite Madeleines are highlights of the menu. With stylish decor and ample space, it’s perfect for a relaxed visit.
address: 55, 9 Soi Saman Chan, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Phrakanong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: De Nada
description_full: Despite being hidden away in a refurbished Thai bungalow just off Sukhumvit Soi 56, this one is worth a stop (if you can spot it from the road). There’s an upstairs area to chill out, ornate furniture, and a very French style feel here. The pastries and light breakfast bites take center stage, with more than a dozen types of croissant you could from ring croissants doused in Nutella to twist croissants stuffed with ham and melted cheese. It’s also pet friendly, so bring along your pooch or feline to rummage around outside. It’s also cheeky, quiet getaway for people who want to work remotely in their own little cabin away from it all.
summary: A hidden gem in a refurbished Thai bungalow, this cozy spot offers a delightful selection of pastries and croissants. Perfect for remote work or a quiet retreat, the space features ornate furniture and a pet-friendly outdoor area. Enjoy light breakfast bites while soaking in the relaxed French-inspired vibe.
address: 35/1-2 Soi Sukhumvit 4 Soi Sukhumvit 4, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Pridi
description_full: From the minds behind Bangkok’s hot F&B spots like Pridi, After You, and Rong Klan Nuea, comes Songwat Coffee Roaster. Their house blend is Brazil Cerrado which lends a satisfying chocolate nutty caramel quality. Grab a cup of joe along with their variety of croissants like the chestnut flavor topped with swirls of mont blanc (B165) or the black sesame pastry mixed with mascarpone (B160).
summary: A cozy bakery offers a delightful range of croissants alongside expertly brewed coffee. Specialty items like the chestnut and black sesame pastries stand out, perfect for a sweet treat. Ideal for casual meet-ups, the inviting atmosphere encourages lingering over your favorite brew.
address: 155 ซ. ปรีดี พนมยงค์ 25 Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Local Boys NEW
description_full: Songwat’s latest cafe, Local Boy Coffee, is open for Bangkok’s legions of picky coffee lovers to explore, experiment, and geek out about your favorite beans. Their Coco Box Coffee (B195) in particular is a must try. With a coconut ice cream tucked in a chocolate shell, the complexities are heightened when the top melts into the shot of coffee underneath. If the caffeine hasn’t lifted up your energy levels, the venue’s feel good playlist that belongs in the Guardians of the Galaxy soundtrack, will certainly do the trick.
summary: A vibrant café invites coffee enthusiasts to explore unique brews and innovative flavors. Highlights include the Coco Box Coffee, featuring coconut ice cream in a chocolate shell that enhances your coffee experience. A feel-good playlist adds to the lively atmosphere, perfect for unwinding with friends.
address: 267, 7 Soi Thong Lo, เเขวงคลองตันเหนือ Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Ega Luv Seafood NEW
description_full: Ega, known for its experimental local Thai food menu on Songwat, has launched its little sister project, Ega Luv Seafood. As the name suggests, the spot shines with its seafood ingredients: grilled, steamed, boiled, and baked to your delight. Go in the morning and you’ll also get your pick of fusion Asian brekkies. Order khao kriap pak mor yuan (B120), thin rice dumplings with a slice of lime to keep things light or try out the udon style kao ji (B50), a hotdog with Thai pork sausage and khun chiang.
summary: A seafood haven on Songwat, the restaurant specializes in grilled, steamed, and baked dishes that highlight fresh ingredients. Morning visits offer a unique fusion breakfast menu with options like rice dumplings and innovative hotdogs. The cozy atmosphere makes it perfect for casual meals or quick bites.
address: 1298, 1306 Song Wat Rd, Khwaeng Chakkrawat, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand

name: Pulse Phra Arthit NEW
description_full: Set up on top of the nostalgic ice cream shop, Coconut Culture, Pulse Phra Arthit carves out a zen space amid the surrounding tourist attractions. Get your fuel before heading to the walking distance of tourist destinations with their selection of baked goods from lemon cake (B130) to matcha strawberry soft cookies (B140). If you’re trekking through the beating sun, we recommend getting a glass of yuzu strawberry soda (B120) for a quick refresher.
summary: A zen space above Coconut Culture offers a serene escape from nearby tourist spots. Baked goods like lemon cake and matcha strawberry soft cookies pair well with refreshing yuzu strawberry soda. Perfect for a quick fuel-up before exploring the area.
address: 100/6 Thanon Phra Athit, Khwaeng Chana Songkhram, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand

name: Songwat Coffee Roaster
description_full: A new station from the Rolling Roasters crew (who are really into coffee) in the heart of downtown, this space gives the coffee bean lovers a space that looks more akin to a futuristic coffee lab than a cafe. And even though this is definitely a spot for the coffee nerds awake early, it’s also serving up some fun food items like their Big Brekkie (B300) and french toast (B250) with strawberries, blueberries, and bananas.
summary: A futuristic coffee lab in downtown invites coffee enthusiasts to explore artisanal brews. Specialty dishes like the Big Brekkie and fruity french toast enhance the experience for food lovers. Perfectly designed for both early risers and casual hangouts, this spot balances quality coffee with a cozy atmosphere.
address: 578 Song Wat Rd, Khwaeng Chakkrawat, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand

name: 5am
description_full: Specializing in soy milk, 5am has a “dark roast” (B40) and “light roast” (B40) option—just like coffee. The dark roast has a heavier body with a soothing smoky aroma while the light brings nostalgic notes of downing a cup of soy milk before going to school. We also recommend the patongko honey lemon (B175), a similar concept to honey toast but topped with a light soft serve and drizzled in a blend of zesty syrup.
summary: A cozy spot specializing in soy milk, offering unique dark and light roast options reminiscent of childhood memories. The menu also features the patongko honey lemon, a delightful twist on honey toast topped with soft serve and zesty syrup. Perfect for casual gatherings, the inviting atmosphere encourages relaxation over comforting treats.
address: 212 Thanon Ban Mo, Khwaeng Wang Burapha Phirom, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand

name: On Lok Yun
description_full: For those who want a little bit of throwback, this legendary 90 years old breakfast spot is the perfect way to start the day. The cafe puts a Thai spin on western style breakfast with the American breakfast (B65) but real fans will be there on the dot for the classic kanom pang sankaya, bread with Thai style egg-coconut milk custard (B28). The affordable lineup would not complete without their coffee which starts at B35.
summary: A legendary breakfast spot with a 90-year history, this cafe offers a delightful Thai twist on Western classics. The kanom pang sankaya, featuring bread with egg-coconut milk custard, is a must-try alongside their affordable coffee options. Open daily, it’s perfect for an easygoing morning meal.
address: 72 ถ. เจริญกรุง Khwaeng Wang Burapha Phirom, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand

name: Punjab Sweets
description_full: Would you like to try something new for your breakfast run? The Phahurat Indian coffee shop offers an endless variety of Indian sweet treats. Try out the crispy and flavorful paneer dosa (B100), the fudge-like barfi bites (B15), and cut the saccharine flavors with some freshly brewed chai tea (B15).
summary: A charming Indian coffee shop serves a delightful array of sweet treats and breakfast options. Specialties include crispy paneer dosa and fudge-like barfi bites, perfectly paired with freshly brewed chai. The inviting atmosphere makes it an ideal spot for a morning indulgence.
address: Chakkraphet Rd, Khwaeng Wang Burapha Phirom, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand

name: Tarns Coffee NEW
description_full: Hidden inside Ari Story hostel, Progress Cafe is the cafe-by-day-and-bar-by-night to know. Those who enjoy fruity coffee can try the Black Yuzu (B120) which is a cold brew with house made yuzu syrup and lime. And get yourself a square of their gooey chocolate brownie (B50) to add some sweetness to your morning. But if you’re more of a smoothie person, their new tropical blend (B135) will give you some pina colada flavor sans alcohol.
summary: Hidden within a hostel, this café transforms into a bar at night, offering a unique blend of fruity coffees and tropical smoothies. Signature drinks like the Black Yuzu cold brew pair well with their indulgent chocolate brownie. A relaxed vibe makes it perfect for unwinding any time of day.
address: 170 11 Suan Phlu Road Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Halfway NEW
description_full: Bangkok is never short of brunch spots, but the true gems are still a bit of a dig. Halfway is a meeting point between Asian-Aussie fusion cuisine and cool drinks. Their dry-aged duck Congee (B300) includes a creamy egg yolk for you to dip with their patongko. And their Veggie Mary (B320) might satisfy your sweet tooth while keeping things fresh and filling.
summary: A trendy spot in Bangkok, fusion dishes blend Asian and Aussie flavors seamlessly. Signature items like dry-aged duck Congee and the refreshing Veggie Mary showcase a creative approach to brunch. Perfect for casual gatherings, the vibe is relaxed yet vibrant.
address: 8 Soi Ngam Du Phli, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: DYSF NEW
description_full: This brand new Sathon cafe is taking the saying “an apple a day keeps the doctor away” quite seriously. DYSF (short for Darlin You’re So Fine) is a two-story brunch to late night eatery, serving several apple based items. The DYSF signature iced tea (B140), for example, contains mini diced apples in a refreshing blend of jasmine yuzu lychee base. For a filling breakfast, DYSF fried chicken (B350) will give you sufficient energy with that kimchi pancake topped with crispy chicken and a tangy secret sauce.
summary: A two-story eatery in Sathon, this café specializes in apple-infused dishes from brunch to late night. Signature drinks like the iced tea blend refreshing jasmine with mini diced apples, while hearty options include fried chicken atop kimchi pancakes. Perfect for casual dining, the atmosphere is vibrant yet relaxed.
address: 92 8 Thanon Naradhiwat Rajanagarindra, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Chennai Kitchen
description_full: A reliable vegetarian Indian breakfast joint, at Chennai Kitchen you’ll find essentials like ghee dosa (B140) which you can request a masala version to up the heat, or the vada (lentil donuts) which seem harmless at first but are stuffed with chili—so tread carefully. But if you’re craving something a little sweet and sour, we recommend the idli Manchurian, deep fried lentil patties in tomato onion sauce. And order some lassi while you’re at it.
summary: A reliable vegetarian Indian breakfast joint serves essential dishes like ghee dosa and spicy vada. Unique options include idli Manchurian, deep-fried lentil patties in a tangy sauce. Pair your meal with a refreshing lassi for the perfect start to your day.
address: 107/3-4, Thanon Pan, Si Lom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Take Eat Easy NEW
description_full: Coming to you from Tim Butler—famed for the fare at spots like Eat Me—this new space is a backyard-style getaway in Yenakart with an all-day dining Northern Californian cuisine. For their breakfast menu which serves from 8am-1pm, you can order the quick breakfast set (B200) which comes with 2 eggs (cooked to your liking) along with some bread, greens, and your choice of coffee or tea. They also got the Full Breakfast option (B450) which adds grilled bacon, tomatoes, potatoes, and champignon to the original mix.
summary: A backyard-style restaurant in Yenakart, the venue offers all-day Northern Californian cuisine. Breakfast favorites include a quick set with eggs and coffee or the hearty Full Breakfast featuring grilled bacon and potatoes. Perfect for casual dining, the laid-back atmosphere invites you to relax and savor your meal.
address: 1757/1 New Petchaburi Rd, บางกะปิ, Khet Huai Khwang, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10310, Thailand

name: Gowin Dimsum NEW
description_full: Taking the dimsum experience to new heights, Kopi Hub Prime Ari doesn’t limit your porridge and xiaomi to regular ingredients; they add to the experience with fancy produce like ikura and truffles. Their patongko (B50) is deep fried and grilled to get that extra crunchiness and fluffy interior. The joint is also famous for their Bak Kuh Teh (B249) and fried tarot which comes in four flavors: seafood curry, red pork, pork curry and truffles.
summary: A vibrant dimsum spot elevates traditional flavors with luxurious ingredients like ikura and truffles. Specialties include the crispy patongko and rich Bak Kuh Teh, perfect for those seeking unique tastes. The inviting atmosphere makes it an excellent choice for casual dining.
address: 11/1 Thanon Sathu Pradit, Khwaeng Chong Nonsi, Khet Yan Nawa, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Just A Drink Maybe
description_full: Sathorn-Silom natives might recognize this blue-navy hang out spot as the casual bar that specializes in concocting gin-based drinks. After a temporary shut down period due to the pandemic, this cozy venue is back up and running with a customizable breakfast menu. Start your day with a classic bagel sandwich, “the GOAT '' in particular, offers a rich layer of cream cheese under crispy bacon, sunny sides, tomatoes, and cheddar cheese.
summary: A cozy bar in Sathorn-Silom, this spot specializes in gin-based cocktails and offers a customizable breakfast menu. The rich bagel sandwich, known as 'the GOAT', combines cream cheese, bacon, and fresh toppings for a delightful start to the day. Perfect for a relaxed atmosphere, it invites locals to unwind with friends or enjoy a quiet moment.
address: 37 Soi Silom 9, Si Lom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Crema Cafe and Books
description_full: Not so far from Chong Nonsi BTS station, this artsy cafe is decorated with colorful tiles, arched doors, and curved furniture. It is known for the smoked salmon cream cheese bagel (B180), but if you want a heavier option, you can go for the four cheese combo (B140). Their new yuzu earl gray creme brulee donut (B85) adds a bit of a sweet option to the pile. Due to the owner’s love of literature, the spot is an attractive hangout for bookworms, offering an interesting collection of photo books and magazines. ●
summary: A vibrant café near Chong Nonsi BTS station features colorful decor and a cozy atmosphere perfect for book lovers. Specialties include the smoked salmon cream cheese bagel and unique yuzu earl gray crème brûlée donut. An interesting collection of photo books adds to the artistic vibe, making it an inviting spot to unwind.
address: 399/4 Silom Soi 7, Si Lom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Bhu Mai
description_full: Bhu Mai - это заведение, расположенное на первом этаже IconSiam, Charoennakorn Soi 5. Здесь царит атмосфера старинной роскоши с темными, земляными цветами и тайскими акцентами, такими как золотые фрески, гирлянды из жасмина и шелковая обивка. Услуги включают массажи: 30 минут за B350, 60 минут за B550 и традиционный тайский массаж на 90 минут за B800. Заведение открыто ежедневно с 10:00 до 22:00.
summary: A luxurious spa on the first floor of IconSiam offers a serene escape with earthy tones and traditional Thai accents. Specialties include various massage options, from quick sessions to a full 90-minute traditional experience. Open daily, it invites guests to unwind in an elegant setting.
address: ICONSIAM, 5th floor, 299 ถ. เจริญนคร แขวงคลองต้นไทร คลองสาน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10600, Thailand

name: Dip Onsen
description_full: Modern designed pools with a surrounding tropical garden, a cool, youthful space for relaxing and just having a good time. The venue offers general admission for B Phahon Yothin 5, Phaya Thai.  daily 8am-10pm.
summary: A modern spa featuring beautifully designed pools surrounded by a lush tropical garden creates a refreshing atmosphere for relaxation. General admission allows guests to unwind in a youthful space, perfect for leisure and enjoyment. Open daily from 8 AM to 10 PM, it's an inviting spot for wellness seekers.
address: 2, 92 Soi Phahon Yothin 5, Phaya Thai, Khet Phaya Thai, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand

name: Health Land
description_full: Neighborhood: Phrom PhongVibe: Calm, secluded, and sophisticated — exactly what you want in a spa that promises to pull out all the stops. Not over-the-top luxurious for the sake of it, but things are intricate here in a way that shows they pay attention to the details that matter. Price: As low as B800 for traditional Thai massage to B20,000 for the “Ultimate Couple Hydrosense” experience that essentially includes every luxury-based spa treatment you could want: Foot Spa, Jacuzzi with hydrotherapy, body scrub, aroma massage, HydraFacial treatment, refreshments, Tea Pairing, chocolates, flowers, and custom requests in advance. Speaking of Hydrafacial sessions, a high-tech, non-invasive skin treatment from the US, starts at just B4,800 (including a cleanse and peel, extract and hydrate, and fuse and protect).
summary: Calm and sophisticated, this spa offers a serene escape with meticulous attention to detail. Treatments range from traditional Thai massages to luxurious experiences featuring hydrotherapy and custom requests. Perfect for relaxation, sessions include high-tech skin treatments that rejuvenate your glow.
address: 55, Sukhumvit 21 Soi 1, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Makkha Health & Spa
description_full: Neighborhood: Phrom PhongVibe: Calm, secluded, and sophisticated — exactly what you want in a spa that promises to pull out all the stops. Not over-the-top luxurious for the sake of it, but things are intricate here in a way that shows they pay attention to the details that matter. Price: As low as B800 for traditional Thai massage to B20,000 for the “Ultimate Couple Hydrosense” experience that essentially includes every luxury-based spa treatment you could want: Foot Spa, Jacuzzi with hydrotherapy, body scrub, aroma massage, HydraFacial treatment, refreshments, Tea Pairing, chocolates, flowers, and custom requests in advance. Speaking of Hydrafacial sessions, a high-tech, non-invasive skin treatment from the US, starts at just B4,800 (including a cleanse and peel, extract and hydrate, and fuse and protect).
summary: A calm and sophisticated spa offers a range of treatments focusing on relaxation and wellness. Specialties include traditional Thai massages starting at B800 and luxurious packages like the 'Ultimate Couple Hydrosense' experience. Attention to detail enhances the serene atmosphere, making it a perfect retreat from city life.
address: 425 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Harnn Spa
description_full: Harnn Spa предлагает успокаивающую атмосферу с современными тайскими интерьерами и большими окнами. Здесь вы можете попробовать терапию Pranakorn: 60-минутный традиционный тайский массаж за B1,800, который использует движения, похожие на йогу, для восстановления подвижности и снятия мышечного напряжения. Также доступны ароматерапия, акупунктура и рефлексология. Адрес:  Central World, 4/5 Rajdamri Road, Pathumwan. Часы работы: ежедневно с 11:00 до 20:00.
summary: A serene spa with modern Thai interiors offers a tranquil escape from the city's hustle. Signature treatments include the Pranakorn therapy, featuring a 60-minute traditional Thai massage that enhances mobility and relieves tension. Aromatherapy, acupuncture, and reflexology services further enhance the wellness experience.
address: 10330, Thailand, Bangkok, Pathum Wan, Bangkok, Zen Tower @ CentralWorld 12Mth floor

name: Infinity
description_full: Price: The infinity aroma, a 60-minute Thai and aromatherapy massage, goes for B1,300, and the infinity deep tissue, a 90-minute treatment for B1,600, designed to break muscle knots and boost energy with improved oxygen flow.
summary: A tranquil spa experience awaits with treatments like the 60-minute Thai and aromatherapy massage. Focused on relieving tension, the deep tissue option enhances energy flow and muscle recovery. Perfect for relaxation after a busy day, this oasis offers a serene escape in the city.
address: No, 22 ซ. สุขุมวิท 20 แขวงคลองเตย เขตคลองเตย กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Let’s Relax Spa
description_full: Let’s Relax Spa offers a unique interior and exterior design influenced by the local background, featuring Thai touches that create a calming atmosphere. Their services include a 120-minute Thai massage for B1,200 and a 90-minute aromatic hot stone treatment for B2,300. The spa is located on the 2nd floor of Park Lane Community Mall, Ekkamai Road, Watthana, and is open daily from 10am to midnight.
summary: A calming atmosphere infused with Thai design welcomes visitors to this spa. Signature treatments include a soothing 120-minute Thai massage and a relaxing aromatic hot stone treatment. Open daily until midnight, it's the perfect spot for unwinding after a long day.
address: 2, 2/1-4 Soi Phraek Samakkhi, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Oasis Spa
description_full: Neighborhood: Phrom PhongVibe: Calm, secluded, and sophisticated — exactly what you want in a spa that promises to pull out all the stops. Not over-the-top luxurious for the sake of it, but things are intricate here in a way that shows they pay attention to the details that matter. Price: As low as B800 for traditional Thai massage to B20,000 for the “Ultimate Couple Hydrosense” experience that essentially includes every luxury-based spa treatment you could want: Foot Spa, Jacuzzi with hydrotherapy, body scrub, aroma massage, HydraFacial treatment, refreshments, Tea Pairing, chocolates, flowers, and custom requests in advance. Speaking of Hydrafacial sessions, a high-tech, non-invasive skin treatment from the US, starts at just B4,800 (including a cleanse and peel, extract and hydrate, and fuse and protect).
summary: A calm and sophisticated spa offers a serene escape with meticulous attention to detail. Specialties include traditional Thai massages and high-tech Hydrafacial treatments, catering to various relaxation needs. Perfect for couples, the luxurious package features everything from foot spas to custom requests.
address: 64 Sukhumvit 31 Yaek 4, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Rarinjinda
description_full: Price: There are three main massages on offer: the aromatherapy oil massage with herbal hot compress for B1,700, the classical Thai massage for B2,000, and the RarinJinda royal touch for B5,600. The royal touch includes a foot soak, guava polish, facial relaxation, reflexology, a four-hands aromatherapy massage, and a herbal hot compress.
summary: A serene spa on the 8th floor, offering a range of massages including aromatherapy and traditional Thai. Special treatments like the royal touch provide a luxurious experience with foot soaks and four-hand massages. Perfect for unwinding in a tranquil setting after a busy day in Bangkok.
address: 8th Floor, Grande Centre Point Hotel, 153/2 Soi Mahatlek Luang 1, Lumphini, Pathumwan, Bangkok 10300, Thailand

name: Yunomori
description_full: Yunomori - это оазис от городской суеты, предлагающий расслабляющую атмосферу в садовом лаундже и на крыше с чаем и видом на небо. Здесь можно насладиться глубоким массажем сна на  Suksawittaya, North Sathorn Road, Silom, Bangrak. Часы работы: ежедневно с 10:00 до полуночи.
summary: A tranquil spa oasis offers a relaxing atmosphere with a garden lounge and rooftop views. Guests can indulge in deep sleep massages that rejuvenate the body and mind. Open daily until midnight, it's an ideal retreat from the city's hustle.
address: 120, 5 Sukhumvit 26, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Auriga at Cappella
description_full: Neighborhood: Phrom PhongVibe: Calm, secluded, and sophisticated — exactly what you want in a spa that promises to pull out all the stops. Not over-the-top luxurious for the sake of it, but things are intricate here in a way that shows they pay attention to the details that matter. Price: As low as B800 for traditional Thai massage to B20,000 for the “Ultimate Couple Hydrosense” experience that essentially includes every luxury-based spa treatment you could want: Foot Spa, Jacuzzi with hydrotherapy, body scrub, aroma massage, HydraFacial treatment, refreshments, Tea Pairing, chocolates, flowers, and custom requests in advance. Speaking of Hydrafacial sessions, a high-tech, non-invasive skin treatment from the US, starts at just B4,800 (including a cleanse and peel, extract and hydrate, and fuse and protect).
summary: A calming spa experience awaits in a sophisticated setting that emphasizes detail and personalization. Specialties include a range of treatments from traditional Thai massages to luxurious couple packages featuring hydrotherapy and Hydrafacial sessions. Perfect for relaxation, the serene atmosphere enhances every service offered.
address: 300 2 ถ. เจริญกรุง Khwaeng Yan Nawa, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Breeze Spa
description_full:
Breeze Spa
Neighborhood: Pratunam
Vibe: Intimate, mood lighting and a melange of ocean-hued and dark wood furnishings.
Price: B4,200 for the one-hour-thirty-minute Energy Boost package, which includes a 30-minute turmeric and lemongrass scrub followed by a 90-minute Thai oil massage using Ayurvedic techniques to help ease strained muscles and a 30-minute facial using eastern massage techniques and crystal therapy to combat dry skin and stimulate cell turnover for younger looking skin.
 Amari Watergate Bangkok, Petchaburi Rd., .  daily 10am-10pm
summary: An intimate spa retreat, mood lighting and ocean-hued decor create a calming atmosphere. Signature treatments include a rejuvenating Energy Boost package featuring Ayurvedic massage techniques and crystal therapy facials. Perfect for those seeking relaxation, the venue offers a holistic approach to wellness.
address: 847 Petchburi Road,, Phaya Thai, Ratchathewi, Bangkok 10400, Thailand

name: Loft Thai X Nakhon Spa
description_full: Loft Thai X Nakhon Spa, расположенный по адресу  Rd., предлагает спокойную, уединенную и утонченную атмосферу. Здесь вы найдете разнообразные спа-процедуры, включая традиционный тайский массаж по цене от B800 до "Ultimate Couple Hydrosense" за B20,000, который включает в себя все возможные роскошные спа-услуги. Часы работы: ежедневно с 10:00 до полуночи.
summary: A serene and sophisticated spa awaits, offering a range of treatments from traditional Thai massages to luxurious couple packages. Each service is designed to provide relaxation in a private setting, making it ideal for unwinding. Open daily from 10 AM to midnight, this venue ensures rejuvenation at any hour.
address: 682/6 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Klongtoey, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Websites
description_full:
World Gourmet Festival 2025: Who to see and where to be
Last week, the 25th World Gourmet Festival announced their full lineup for the upcoming festivities, and, to put it mildly, there are some big names on the list.

1 day 23 hours ago
things to do
News
summary: Celebrating culinary excellence, this festival showcases renowned chefs and their signature dishes. Attendees can indulge in a diverse range of gourmet experiences that highlight global flavors. With an exciting lineup each year, the atmosphere buzzes with food lovers eager to discover new tastes.
address: 51/43 2 Century Heights Sukhumvit Soi 23 Klongtoei Nua Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Nitra Serenity Centre at 137 Pillars
description_full: Vibe: A modern spa design decorated with Thai exotic art and decor, but with a homey yet clinical touch. The Nitra Raya signature treatment (B Sukhumvit 39, .  daily 10am-8pm.
summary: A modern spa adorned with Thai art creates a unique blend of homey comfort and clinical precision. The Nitra Raya signature treatment stands out, offering a serene escape from the bustle of city life. With a focus on wellness, this space invites relaxation and rejuvenation.
address: 59, 59/1 Soi Sukhumvit 39, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Neighborhoo
description_full: Vibe: A modern spa design decorated with Thai exotic art and decor, but with a homey yet clinical touch. The Nitra Raya signature treatment (B Sukhumvit 39, .  daily 10am-8pm.
summary: A modern spa combines Thai exotic art with a homey yet clinical atmosphere. Signature treatments offer relaxation in an inviting setting, making it perfect for unwinding. Open daily, this spot provides a serene escape from the city's hustle.
address: 59/27 Soi Thanying Phuangrat Praphai, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Okura
description_full: Vibe: A serene atmosphere, refined decor, and soothing treatments create a luxurious sanctuary, offering a peaceful escape from the city. Price: The Okura Spa’s lavender escape package offers  Rd., .  daily from 10am-8pm.
summary: A serene atmosphere and refined decor create a luxurious escape from the city. Specializing in soothing treatments, the venue offers a range of wellness packages for relaxation. Perfect for unwinding, it invites guests to enjoy a peaceful sanctuary.
address: 57, Park Ventures Ecoplex 57 Thanon Witthayu, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: I.Sawan Residential Spa
description_full: A villa-styled retreat with soothing interiors that effuse an effortless, luxe look. The energy escape package provides a 120-minute experience for B5,600, including a 30-minute Himalayan crystal scrub and a 90-minute sports massage. The signature escape offers a 180-minute session for B9,000, featuring white lotus skin conditioning scrub and wrap, massage, and facial cleansing. Located on the 5F of Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok, 494 Ratchadamri Road.  daily from 9am to 10pm.
summary: A villa-styled retreat offers a serene ambiance with luxurious interiors. Specialty treatments like the energy escape package and signature escape provide rejuvenating experiences for body and mind. Located on the 5th floor of Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok, relaxation awaits daily from 9 am to 10 pm.
address: Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok 494 Rajdamri Road Khwaeng, แขวงลุมพินี เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand

name: Banyan Tree Spa Bangkok
description_full: Banyan Tree Spa Bangkok - это спа с панорамным видом на городской горизонт, оформленный в традиционном тайском стиле с драматическими акцентами. Цены на услуги, такие как  Rd., телефон: . Открыто ежедневно с 10:00 до 20:00.
summary: A serene spa offers panoramic views of the city skyline, enveloped in traditional Thai decor. Specializing in relaxation therapies, it provides a tranquil escape from the urban hustle. Open daily from 10:00 to 20:00, guests can unwind with a variety of treatments.
address: 21/100 S Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Panpuri Organic Spa at Park Hyatt Bangkok
description_full: Panpuri Organic Spa at Park Hyatt Bangkok - это минималистичное и утонченное пространство, наполненное естественным светом, с элементами мрамора и чистым декором в натуральных тонах. Услуга "Ultimate relaxation package" включает  Rd., телефон: . Открыто ежедневно с 10:00 до 22:30.
summary: A minimalist spa infused with natural light creates a serene atmosphere for relaxation. The Ultimate Relaxation Package showcases luxurious treatments in an elegant setting. Focused on wellness, the venue emphasizes organic and holistic practices.
address: 11th floor, 88 (Central Embassy Park Hyatt Bangkok Thanon Witthayu, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Opium Spa
description_full: Price: B11,800 for a 240-minute Serenity at the Siam package, which includes a body balance salt therapy exfoliant, using Himalayan salt and plant essences to massage your entire body, followed by a 15-minute steam room session and a full body massage using Australia’s Sodashi serenity oil. Complete your pampering experience with an intensely moisturizing French clay body mask and Sodashi thermal infusion facial treatment.
summary: A serene spa experience awaits with the luxurious Serenity at the Siam package, featuring Himalayan salt exfoliation and soothing massages. Indulge in a steam session followed by a hydrating clay body mask and revitalizing facial treatment. Perfect for unwinding, this oasis focuses on holistic wellness and relaxation.
address: The Siam 3, 2 Khao, Vachirapayabal, Khet Dusit, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10300, Thailand

name: Sukhothai Spa
description_full: Price: The Sukhothai Bangkok offers the one night spa indulgence package for B11,800, including a deluxe room and breakfast. The 60-minute signature massage (B1,000) offers foot treatment, and wellness activities. The two night spa indulgence package for B18,800 adds a bath ritual and an optional executive suite upgrade for B2,500 per night.
summary: A serene oasis, Sukhothai Spa offers rejuvenating treatments in a tranquil setting. Signature massages combine foot care with wellness activities, ensuring a relaxing experience. Indulge in luxurious packages that include deluxe accommodations and breakfast.
address: 13/3 S Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Calm Cottage
description_full: Neighborhood: Phrom PhongVibe: Calm, secluded, and sophisticated — exactly what you want in a spa that promises to pull out all the stops. Not over-the-top luxurious for the sake of it, but things are intricate here in a way that shows they pay attention to the details that matter. Price: As low as B800 for traditional Thai massage to B20,000 for the “Ultimate Couple Hydrosense” experience that essentially includes every luxury-based spa treatment you could want: Foot Spa, Jacuzzi with hydrotherapy, body scrub, aroma massage, HydraFacial treatment, refreshments, Tea Pairing, chocolates, flowers, and custom requests in advance. Speaking of Hydrafacial sessions, a high-tech, non-invasive skin treatment from the US, starts at just B4,800 (including a cleanse and peel, extract and hydrate, and fuse and protect).
summary: A sophisticated spa exuding calm and seclusion invites relaxation. Specialties include traditional Thai massages starting at B800 and luxurious treatments like the Ultimate Couple Hydrosense experience. Attention to detail enhances every visit, making it a truly personalized escape.
address: 888, 63-64 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Lime by Us
description_full: Bar Us, christened as Best Cocktail Bar at the BAD Awards 2024 and the new entry No.21 in the latest Asia’s 50 Best Bars, recently opened a sister project in the same building. While Bar Us makes savory concoctions in a multi-course (starters, mains, and dessert) menu, Lime by Us promises a fruitier and more approachable line up that’ll impress.
summary: A vibrant bar offers a fruity cocktail menu that’s both approachable and impressive. Perfect for casual gatherings, the atmosphere is relaxed yet stylish. With its recent accolades, this spot stands out in the local nightlife scene.
address: 61, 37 Sukhumvit 26, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Beer Pradith
description_full: The hype on Banthat Thong isn’t slowing down. Amid the old school street food and trendy cafes that have popped up in recent years, Beer Pradith has become the hot neighborhood’s latest offering, serving up 24 taps of Thai craft beer sourced from all over the Kingdom.
summary: A vibrant bar in Banthat Thong, the venue showcases 24 taps of Thai craft beer from across the Kingdom. With a lively atmosphere, it attracts both locals and visitors looking to unwind. The blend of old-school street food with trendy vibes creates a unique experience.
address: 2030 Banthat Thong Rd, Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Backroom
description_full: In the hurleyburley of Sathorn, Yenakart gives you a bit of break from it all. The Backroom set itself up in this business district to dole out booze and high quality seafood sourced from all over Thailand. The bar at Backroom uses the art of clarification in their signature sips, producing drinks that go down smoother.
summary: A serene escape in Sathorn, a range of high-quality seafood complements expertly crafted cocktails. Signature drinks utilize the art of clarification for a smooth experience. Perfect for unwinding after a busy day, the vibe is both relaxed and sophisticated.
address: 35/5 - 35/7, second floor, Soi Si Bamphen, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Jiaozi Jiuba
description_full: After establishing itself as Samyan’s friendly neighborhood dumpling spot, Jiaozi is extending its reach to Gaysorn Amarin—bringing fan-favorite signature dishes and adding cocktails to the mix. The Hutong Bay (B328) has the sweet and sour notes of a pina colada but bay leaves and mala powder on the rim adds spicy and aromatic flavors to cut through the sugar nicely. 4F, Gaysorn Amarin, 496 502 Ploenchit Rd., 080 835 7504.  daily 11am-9pm.
summary: A vibrant bar serves signature dumplings alongside expertly crafted cocktails. The Hutong Bay cocktail blends sweet and sour flavors with a spicy kick, making it a standout choice. Perfect for casual gatherings, the atmosphere is welcoming and relaxed.
address: 4 Floor, 496 502 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Sababa
description_full: From F&B pioneers attached to names like Gigi and Iron Balls, comes Sababa, a fusion blend of Mediterranean izakaya tucked away in a home-y lush patch of eden in Thonglor 13. Sababa stocks up on their Mediterranean imported wines and seven signature cocktails. Each paying homage to popular vista treats like Parmesan Espresso Martini (B350) and Parma & Melon (B300). Japanese beer, sake, and mocktails are also available on hand. After all, you can rely on an izakaya for a good time.
summary: A cozy bar in Thonglor 13 blends Mediterranean flavors with a relaxed izakaya vibe. Signature cocktails like the Parmesan Espresso Martini and imported wines create a unique drinking experience. With options for Japanese beer and mocktails, guests can enjoy a laid-back evening here.
address: 53 S. Torsak Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Frog Bar
description_full: Filled with Japanese literary and pop culture references familiar to Thai customers, the drinks take cues from Japanese beats and blend it with local ingredients. The first welcome shot is a Nikolaschka which appeared in the 2024 anime of the popular “Bartender” manga. The main portion of the drink, however, steals a couple of pages from Haruki Murakami’s award winning “Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World”, splitting the cocktail menu into classics with a twist and new creations.
summary: A vibrant bar infused with Japanese literary and pop culture, offering unique cocktails that blend local ingredients. Specialties include a welcome shot inspired by the 'Bartender' manga and a menu featuring classic drinks with creative twists. Perfect for those seeking a cultural drink experience in a lively atmosphere.
address: 237 Sukhumvit 49, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Bukowski & Co.
description_full: A playful homage to the famous Paris bookstore Shakespeare and Company, Bukowski & Co. is Songwat’s latest community bar that’s all about fostering community and spontaneity. Every couple of days, the spot will rotate out a different bartender, so you’ll get a customized experience that’s tailored by the bartender’s personality and expertise. Their fixed menu is inspired by films.
summary: A community-focused bar celebrates spontaneity with a rotating cast of bartenders, ensuring each visit feels unique. Inspired by films, the menu offers creative cocktails that reflect cinematic themes. The inviting atmosphere fosters connections among patrons, making it a perfect spot for casual gatherings.
address: 1338B Song Wat Rd, Khwaeng Chakkrawat, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand

name: Akara Sky Hanuman
description_full: Set on the 61st Floor of Phloechit’s One City Centre building, Akara Sky Hanuman intends to be the next landmark for tourists and neighborhood party goers searching for a crash course in Thai culture. Their signature cocktails are designed by Lost in Thaislation’s Suchada “Fahbeer” Sopajaree who concocted a list of drinks based on Thai fruits. We recommend the Farang (B590), which uses the juicier pink guava instead of the common starchier white guava. This is already a refreshing ingredient on its own but coupled with vodka and the surprisingly complementary shot of espresso, you’ll be on high alert the whole night.
summary: Set on the 61st floor, this rooftop bar offers a stunning view and a unique take on Thai culture. Signature cocktails feature local fruits, with the Farang showcasing pink guava paired with vodka and espresso for a refreshing twist. Perfect for nightlife enthusiasts, it creates an inviting atmosphere for both tourists and locals.
address: 548 One City Centre, 58fl.-61fl, ถนน เพลินจิต แขวงลุมพินี เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand

name: Fatboy Izakaya Amarin
description_full: The city’s favorite space for Japanese food with a party vibe, Fatboy Izakaya, has finally opened another branch at the newly renovated Gaysorn Amarin, serving everyone’s grub and drinks—now with a view. Most of their cocktails are easy-to-drink classics with a Fatboy twist. We ordered the O-Ren Ishi (B380). The sunset gradient with a satisfying cloud of foam tastes like a lychee martini but leans more towards the tropical side with an additional hit from peach, orange, and splashes of sake and soju.
summary: A lively spot for Japanese cuisine, the bar offers a vibrant atmosphere with stunning views. Signature cocktails like the O-Ren Ishi showcase a blend of tropical flavors, perfect for unwinding. This location combines delicious food and drinks with a fun party vibe.
address: Gaysorn Amarin ชั้น 3 496 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Blessing Shophouse
description_full: Tucked behind a row of shophouses, Asoke’s latest bar takes ingredients believed to bring good fortune and crafts them into Chinese-Thai inspired cocktails. Upon entering, you’ll receive a complimentary oolong tea to ease your spirit. Cup of Cha Cha (B 14 Alley, 095 596 4655,  Wed-Sun 6pm-12am
summary: A hidden gem, this bar combines Chinese-Thai flavors in its unique cocktails aimed at bringing good fortune. Guests are welcomed with complimentary oolong tea, setting a calming vibe perfect for unwinding. Open Wednesday to Sunday, the space invites relaxation and conversation.
address: 6 5 Soi Phraek Samakkhi, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Nova Social Club
description_full: Minutes away from Phra Khanong BTS station sits Cielo Sky Bar, one of the highest bars on the Sukhumvit line, and they’ve recently sectioned off an area for their sister bar, Nova Social Club. The new cocktail lounge menu is inspired by six atmospheric levels, playing with varying degrees of temperature and innovative flavor profile.
summary: A stylish cocktail lounge nestled near Phra Khanong BTS, this venue offers a unique menu inspired by atmospheric levels and innovative flavors. With a focus on creating a relaxed yet vibrant nightlife experience, guests can enjoy expertly crafted drinks in an inviting setting. Perfect for those looking to unwind with friends or kick off a night out.
address: Cielo Sky Bar & Restaurant, 1595/500 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Phra Khanong Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Amaris Cocktail Bar
description_full: Bar Us, christened as Best Cocktail Bar at the BAD Awards 2024 and the new entry No.21 in the latest Asia’s 50 Best Bars, recently opened a sister project in the same building. While Bar Us makes savory concoctions in a multi-course (starters, mains, and dessert) menu, Lime by Us promises a fruitier and more approachable line up that’ll impress.
summary: A lively cocktail bar offers a vibrant atmosphere with a focus on approachable, fruity drinks. Specialty cocktails impress guests while enjoying the casual yet stylish setting. Perfect for socializing, this venue brings a fresh twist to the cocktail scene.
address: 144/1 Pridi Banomyong 31 Alley, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Dry Wave Cocktail Studio
description_full: Supawit “Palm” Muttarattana is a name that F&B fans will recognize. On the scene since 2009, Palm has supervised favorite Bangkok nightlife spots—including from the enthralling nightclub Fuchsia to the award winning Vesper. Now, Palm has launched his first solo project at Dry Wave Cocktail Studio. The “Super Classic” cocktail concept highlights Palm’s talent in making classic cocktails with the gimmick of combining two classics in one glass. Take the bestselling underdog Morning Tijuana (B400). The smoky flavors can be attributed to mezcal Margarita while the tropical elements come from Breakfast Martini.
summary: A vibrant cocktail studio showcases the artistry of classic drinks with a unique twist. Specialties include the bestselling Morning Tijuana, blending smoky mezcal Margarita with tropical Breakfast Martini. The inviting atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for cocktail enthusiasts to unwind.
address: 2nd Floor SODALITY, 263 ซอย ทองหล่อ 13 แขวงคลองตันเหนือ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Brut
description_full: Brut, a little speakeasy hidden away in Ari, opened its doors in February, and owner Jiravach ‘James’ Vacharaswetsophon and head bartender Tanut ‘Tee’ Wangsagul take their inspiration from brutalist architecture. The cocktail menu takes its cues from brutalism, film, photography, and literature. The fruity cocktail Boise (B360) is named after the nickname for Oscar Wilde’s lover, Lord Alfred Douglas, a fruity gin-based drink with notes of strawberry, grape, lychee, lime, and orange slices with a jasmine syrup.
summary: A hidden speakeasy in Ari, the bar showcases a unique cocktail menu inspired by brutalist architecture and artistic themes. Fruity concoctions like Boise offer a refreshing twist with layers of flavor, perfect for intimate gatherings. The design-forward space invites guests to enjoy craft cocktails in a cozy atmosphere.
address: 29 Prachanimit 1 Alley Phayathai, Khet Phaya Thai, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand

name: GOD Bar
description_full: GOD, short for Genius On Drugs, boasts an ambitious team of co-founders: Gunn Lee, Attapon De-Silva, and Niks Anuman. Together, the team has been behind the success of establishments such as Teens of Thailand, Asia Today, Tax, and Independence Bar. The menu embodies the ethos of  “excessive is necessary,” introducing the idea of pairing drinks with contrasting yet complementary small bites.
summary: A vibrant bar with a creative twist, the menu features bold drink pairings alongside unique small bites. Ambitious co-founders bring a wealth of experience from renowned venues to create a lively atmosphere. Perfect for those seeking innovative flavors in a social setting.
address: 22 Si Lom Rd, Khwaeng Suriya Wong, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Rogues Bar
description_full: Hot off its launch in the beginning of February, Rogues Bar is gearing up to greet lovers, singles, and everything in between with their globe-trotting inspired cocktails and collection of jazz tracks. Their signature craft cocktails are a tribute to the metropolitan capitals of the world. The Salute To The World is designed to capture the vibes of extravagant Gatsby-esque parties, and the Samurai Angel is inspired by Tarantino’s cult classic “Kill Bill,” a smoky, spirit-forward drink with hints of matcha tea and chocolate bitters.
summary: A vibrant bar welcomes all with globe-inspired cocktails and a curated jazz soundtrack. Signature drinks like the Salute To The World and Samurai Angel offer unique flavor profiles that reflect cultural influences. Perfect for an evening of relaxation, the atmosphere captures the essence of sophisticated gatherings.
address: 10 Sukhumvit 59, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Tribe Sky Beach Club
description_full: Tribe Sky Beach Club is a stylish tropical beach oasis and Bangkok’s only sky beach club. Doors open at 11am, and guests can enjoy a day party or a swim in the sprawling pool spilling over Bangkok’s skyline. As the sun sets, the ambiance shifts, with tribal house, Latin beats, and techno music coming alive, accompanied by live entertainment and bands. Colorful neon lights illuminate the venue, and fruity cocktails are on offer. Food options include Neapolitan-certified pizza, pasta, tacos, and bar snacks.
summary: A stylish tropical beach oasis, this sky beach club offers a vibrant day party atmosphere with a sprawling pool and skyline views. As night falls, tribal house and Latin beats energize the space, enhanced by live entertainment. Cocktails and a diverse menu featuring Neapolitan pizza and tacos make for a lively experience.
address: 628 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Pili Pala
description_full: Planning to go off the rails this weekend? Pili Pala Drunken Room is Silom’s latest destination, drawing in patrons with locomotive designs and fruity signature cocktails. Here, the signatures are all about fruit infused alcohols. It’s the type of harmless sweet and sour low-ABV drinks that go down easily but are actually quite intense.
summary: A vibrant bar in Silom, this spot draws attention with its unique locomotive decor and fruity cocktails. Signature drinks highlight fruit-infused alcohols, offering a sweet yet intense flavor profile. Perfect for a lively night out, the atmosphere is both fun and inviting.
address: Room 1 BTS/MRT Soi Sukhumvit 23, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: 4th Wall
description_full: Proving that the classic cocktail revival trend is alive and thriving in Bangkok, 4th Wall opened without a signature menu. Instead, the venue’s signature is their rotation of crowd faves and niche classics that change daily. Since 4th Wall is all about classic drinks, the snacks keep with the theme. Vesper fans who migrated here won’t miss out on the bar’s top notch guacamole because the 4th Wall has as a local fusion of the guac (B200), mixing the avocado dip with a popular Thai seafood sauce, extra lime juice, fish sauce, and chili.
summary: A vibrant bar in Bangkok showcases a rotating selection of classic cocktails and crowd favorites. Snacks complement the drinks, featuring a unique fusion guacamole that blends Thai seafood sauce with avocado for a local twist. Perfect for cocktail enthusiasts, the atmosphere invites experimentation and enjoyment.
address: Luxx Langsuan, 828 Renaissance Bangkok Ratchaprasong Hotel แขวงลุมพินี เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand

name: Lloyd’s Club
description_full: Paper Plane Project has been behind some crackerjack hangout spots in Bangkok—Tichuca, Gir, Bar 335, and Bar Scofflaws—and now they’re turning their hand to a private clubhouse, Lloyd’s Club, set in the Metropole Bangkok. A corner of the first level is dedicated to a private and cozy open bar where a rotation of seasonal cocktails and off the menu classics are paired with nibbles. On the second floor, Lloyd’s Club offers an intimate setting, completed with private chambers, perfect for a personalized rendezvous.
summary: A private clubhouse in the Metropole Bangkok, this venue features a cozy open bar serving seasonal cocktails and classic nibbles. Intimate chambers on the second floor create a perfect setting for personalized gatherings. With a focus on exclusivity, it offers a unique nightlife experience.
address: Skhumvit 55 Khlong Tan Nuea Subdistrict, แขวงบางกะปิ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Tulum Sky Bar
description_full: Minutes away from Phra Khanong BTS station sits Cielo Sky Bar, one of the highest bars on the Sukhumvit line, and they’ve recently sectioned off an area for their sister bar, Nova Social Club. The new cocktail lounge menu is inspired by six atmospheric levels, playing with varying degrees of temperature and innovative flavor profile.
summary: A rooftop bar near Phra Khanong BTS offers innovative cocktails inspired by unique atmospheric levels. With its stylish design, the space is perfect for enjoying a night out with friends or a romantic evening. The addition of Nova Social Club enhances the vibrant nightlife experience.
address: 559 Soi Sukhumvit 63, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Allso Bar
description_full: There’s no shortage of mixology takeovers, international guest shifts, and theme night cocktails in Bangkok. But there are very few spaces with affordable craft cocktail shophouse bars—fewer still in the Thonglor area. Owner Roe Laophermsook tells BK that this spot is trying to democratize drinks for everyone. On the menu you’ll find seven signature cocktails, starting out with the likes of the Thaipirina (B 8. .  daily Thu-Mon 5pm-late.
summary: A welcoming bar in Thonglor, this spot offers affordable craft cocktails with a focus on accessibility. Signature drinks include the Thaipirina, showcasing creative mixology without breaking the bank. Perfect for casual evenings, the ambiance is laid-back yet vibrant.
address: 46/12, Sukhumwit 36, 8 Soi Sansabai, แขวงพระโขนง เขตคลองเตย กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Maria Bar
description_full: Phra Khanong isn’t exactly known for being the place you get dressed up to hit the wine bars, but that’s changing with Maria Bar, the neighborhood’s chic new dating and hangout spot to swirl your wine and sip cocktails (with a little bit of religion thrown into the mix). Keeping on theme and on-the-nose, their signature cocktail Blessing is exactly that—especially with their photogenic sunset hues. This one is for those who enjoy a sweet cocktail. For sides to go with your sips, the crowd favorite Friend's Triple Dip consists of three types of fries and three types of in-house sauce that comes in a portion perfect for sharing.
summary: A chic spot in Phra Khanong, this bar offers a relaxed atmosphere for sipping wine and cocktails. Signature drinks like the Blessing showcase vibrant hues, while the crowd-favorite Friend's Triple Dip invites sharing with friends. Perfect for casual hangouts or dates, the vibe is warm and welcoming.
address: 4th Flr, 1511/1-4 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Phra Khanong Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Ang Yi
description_full: As we roll over to the latter half of the year, BK has gathered Bangkok’s hottest nightlife spots that you might have missed. So, you can celebrate milestones, catch up with friends, and party through the rest of 2024 in style.
summary: A vibrant bar infused with Japanese culture, offering a unique cocktail experience. Perfect for celebrating milestones or enjoying a night out with friends. The atmosphere is lively and inviting, making it an ideal spot to unwind and socialize.
address: 82 Thanon Phat Sai, Khwaeng Samphanthawong, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand

name: Last Call Bar
description_full: With names like Sugar Ray and You’ve Just Been Poisoned under his belt, Vipop “Tor” Jinaphan’s latest project is definitely something to look out for. Enter Last Call Bar, a spot that’s scaling things down and going back to the basics. You can get high quality classic cocktails and customized drinks based on the available collection of beer, champagne, and sake.
summary: A cozy bar focuses on high-quality classic cocktails and personalized drinks crafted from a selection of beer, champagne, and sake. Set in a laid-back atmosphere, it invites patrons to enjoy a return to cocktail basics. Perfect for casual gatherings, the menu showcases the expertise of renowned mixologist Vipop “Tor” Jinaphan.
address: 413 10-12 Soi Thong Lo, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: The Brass & Cigar Lounge
description_full: Tucked beside the French Sathorn resto, Brasserie 9, The Brass & Cigar Lounge is a brand new art nouveau bar that takes the stylised aesthetic movements through the decor down to the drinks. The menu takes us through boughs of seasons from the gin based sweet and sour spring inspired drink to the warm vodka absinthe based winter tipple.
summary: A stylish art nouveau bar showcases a unique decor that complements its seasonal cocktail menu. From refreshing gin-based drinks to warming vodka absinthe concoctions, each sip reflects the changing seasons. Perfect for those seeking a sophisticated yet cozy atmosphere.
address: Phiphat 2, Si Lom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Good Old Times
description_full: Good Old Times, or GOT for short, is the type of versatile nightlife spot that slowly escalates the vibes through the night, taking you from a speakeasy to a full fledged night club blasting 80-90s throwbacks. The cocktails fall under a timeless with a twist concept. Try the Bee’s Knees, a zesty classic given a savory spin with mustard dollops and red shiso leaves or the Low ABV Espresso Martini that’s been shaken with ginger ale for an intriguing touch.
summary: A versatile nightlife spot transforms from a cozy speakeasy to an energetic club with 80-90s throwbacks. Signature cocktails like the savory Bee’s Knees and Low ABV Espresso Martini offer unique twists on classics. Perfect for those looking to enjoy a vibrant evening out.
address: 97 Soi Sukhumvit 24, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Invitation Only
description_full: Amidst the busy streets of Sathorn, Empire Tower is one of the hang spots filled with new cafes and restaurants. All the way up to the 55th Floor, the team from Cassette Music Bar set up Invitation Only, a bar that comes with a panoramic sunset view and nostalgic cocktails from homemade ingredients. Contrary to typical small portion bar grubs, Invitation Only takes their food menu seriously with piri piri chicken skewers to lamb chop chimichurri to fuel you through the night.
summary: A rooftop bar on the 55th floor offers stunning panoramic views and a nostalgic cocktail menu crafted from homemade ingredients. Specialties include hearty dishes like piri piri chicken skewers and lamb chop chimichurri, ensuring a fulfilling night out. The ambiance is perfect for unwinding after a busy day in Sathorn.
address: 55FL, Empire Tower, 1 S Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Yan Nawa, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Tic Tac Toe
description_full: Founded by the owner of the Echelon club, the recently launched Tic Tac Toe is bringing a dating bar theme to the top of Emsphere. There are private areas, counter bars, and a dance floor that’s decked out with the air of an upscale hotel. To ensure maximum entertainment, the venue has installed a music festival-quality sound system for their DJ to pump out party tracks all night long. Keeping with the theme, you can also request to display your name and social media handles on the LED screen for that special someone (or anyone).
summary: A vibrant dating bar on the top of Emsphere, this venue features private areas and a lively dance floor. Upscale ambiance meets a high-quality sound system, ensuring an energetic atmosphere for partying. Guests can personalize their experience by showcasing names on an LED screen, adding a unique touch to social interactions.
address: Empshere, 5th Floor, 628 ถ. สุขุมวิท แขวงคลองตัน เขตคลองเตย กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Raze Arcade
description_full: Another nightlife destination that has opened up in EmWonder, Emsphere’s latest hang spot on the top floor. Raze Arcade mixes a retro New York setting with Formula 1 touches. As a social bar, you can expect some high octane tunes with a cocktail twist. But the main attraction is the F1 simulator arcade game and a large TV where fans can enjoy watching the race.
summary: A vibrant bar on the top floor of EmWonder, blending retro New York vibes with Formula 1 flair. High-energy tunes and creative cocktails set the mood, while an F1 simulator arcade game and a large screen for races steal the show. Perfect for socializing and enjoying thrilling moments with friends.
address: Empshere, 5th Floor, 628 ถ. สุขุมวิท แขวงคลองตัน เขตคลองเตย กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Leave a Comment
description_full:
