View More New Places
summary: A laid-back bar offers a diverse selection of cocktails and local beers. Perfect for unwinding after work, the ambiance encourages friendly conversation. Unique touches in decor create a welcoming atmosphere for all guests.
address: Bangkok, Thailand

name: Jiaozi JiubaPhoto:Jiaozi Jiuba
description_full: After establishing itself as Samyan’s friendly neighborhood dumpling spot, Jiaozi is extending its reach to Gaysorn Amarin—bringing fan-favorite signature dishes and adding cocktails to the mix. The Hutong Bay (B328) has the sweet and sour notes of a pina colada but bay leaves and mala powder on the rim adds spicy and aromatic flavors to cut through the sugar nicely. 4F, Gaysorn Amarin, 496 502 Ploenchit Rd., 080 835 7504.  daily 11am-9pm.
summary: A lively bar in Gaysorn Amarin, this spot serves up beloved dumplings alongside creative cocktails. Signature drinks like the Hutong Bay blend sweet and spicy notes for a unique experience. Perfect for casual gatherings, the inviting atmosphere encourages relaxed conversations.
address: 4 Floor, 496 502 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: SababaPhoto: Sababa
description_full: From F&B pioneers attached to names like Gigi and Iron Balls, comes Sababa, a fusion blend of Mediterranean izakaya tucked away in a home-y lush patch of eden in Thonglor 13. Sababa stocks up on their Mediterranean imported wines and seven signature cocktails. Each paying homage to popular vista treats like Parmesan Espresso Martini (B350) and Parma & Melon (B300). Japanese beer, sake, and mocktails are also available on hand. After all, you can rely on an izakaya for a good time.
summary: A fusion of Mediterranean flavors, this bar offers a cozy atmosphere with lush surroundings. Signature cocktails like the Parmesan Espresso Martini and Parma & Melon showcase creative mixology. Imported wines and Japanese beers enhance the vibrant izakaya experience.
address: 53 S. Torsak Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Bukowski & Co.Photo: Bukowski & Co. / BK Magazine
description_full: A playful homage to the famous Paris bookstore Shakespeare and Company, Bukowski & Co. is Songwat’s latest community bar that’s all about fostering community and spontaneity. Every couple of days, the spot will rotate out a different bartender, so you’ll get a customized experience that’s tailored by the bartender’s personality and expertise. Their fixed menu is inspired by films.
summary: A vibrant community bar draws inspiration from the iconic Shakespeare and Company bookstore. With a rotating cast of bartenders, each visit offers a unique drink experience shaped by individual styles. The menu, influenced by films, adds an artistic twist to your night out.
address: 1338B Song Wat Rd, Khwaeng Chakkrawat, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand

name: 4th WallPhoto: 4th Wall / BK Magazine
description_full: Proving that the classic cocktail revival trend is alive and thriving in Bangkok, 4th Wall opened without a signature menu. Instead, the venue’s signature is their rotation of crowd faves and niche classics that change daily. Since 4th Wall is all about classic drinks, the snacks keep with the theme. Vesper fans who migrated here won’t miss out on the bar’s top notch guacamole because the 4th Wall has as a local fusion of the guac (B200), mixing the avocado dip with a popular Thai seafood sauce, extra lime juice, fish sauce, and chili.
summary: A vibrant bar in Bangkok, the focus shifts daily with a rotating selection of classic cocktails and crowd favorites. Signature snacks like a unique guacamole blend local flavors with traditional recipes. Perfect for cocktail enthusiasts, the atmosphere is casual yet lively.
address: ชั้น 7 โซน B ใกล้MK Center 444 M.B.K. Khwaeng Wang Mai, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Lloyd’s ClubPhoto: Lloyd’s Club
description_full: Paper Plane Project has been behind some crackerjack hangout spots in Bangkok—Tichuca, Gir, Bar 335, and Bar Scofflaws—and now they’re turning their hand to a private clubhouse, Lloyd’s Club, set in the Metropole Bangkok. A corner of the first level is dedicated to a private and cozy open bar where a rotation of seasonal cocktails and off the menu classics are paired with nibbles. On the second floor, Lloyd’s Club offers an intimate setting, completed with private chambers, perfect for a personalized rendezvous.
summary: A private clubhouse in Metropole Bangkok, this venue features a cozy open bar with seasonal cocktails and classic nibbles. Intimate settings on the second floor include private chambers ideal for personalized gatherings. The vibe is relaxed yet exclusive, perfect for those seeking a unique nightlife experience.
address: Skhumvit 55 Khlong Tan Nuea Subdistrict, แขวงบางกะปิ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Al Gatto Nero
description_full: If you’re a fan of Italian cuisine, you know About Eatery. Asoke’s favorite Italian dining room has refashioned itself into Al Gatto Nero, an approachable trattoria space. They kept up with the pasta quality and are showing off their fresh homemade pizza with the venue’s very own oven. Their slow-cooked beef cheek is paired with some mash and cream. Stewed in a rich red wine sauce, the beef cheek offers texture so delicate that you can slice it open without using much force with a single fork.
summary: An approachable trattoria space offers a delightful Italian experience with fresh homemade pizzas baked in-house. Specialties include slow-cooked beef cheek, known for its tender texture and rich red wine sauce. Perfect for those craving authentic flavors in a cozy atmosphere.
address: Ocean Tower II, สุขุมวิท 21 ซอย 3 แขวงคลองเตยเหนือ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Al Saray (Sathorn)
description_full: Having launched two previous successful openings in Huai Khwang and Silom, the beloved Lebanese and Indian joint is set up in Sathorn Soi 6 just a couple of BTS stations away, but it sure makes a difference when you don’t want to trek back to the office after a big lunch. The new venue features the mysterious “flavor meets entertainment” concept and promises an eventful welcoming.
summary: A vibrant spot in Sathorn, this Lebanese and Indian restaurant blends culinary delights with entertainment. Known for its lively atmosphere, the venue offers a unique dining experience just minutes away from the BTS. Perfect for a casual lunch or an evening out, it welcomes guests with a flair for flavor.
address: 60 2 Soi Si Lom 2/1, Khwaeng Suriya Wong, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Baba
description_full: Baba’s casual Indian bites, situated in Marche Thonglor, is all about showing off their fire and smoke mastery in an upscale and cozy dining spot. For extra authenticity points, the restaurant imports key ingredients from India and uses seasonal produce from Thailand for local flair. You can start with the bitsize mimosas and pair their black truffle cream cheese naan with some spicy lamb vindaloo. The tulsi chicken tikka is just one of the dishes that this joint chooses to show off their fire.
summary: Casual Indian bites shine in a cozy dining spot, showcasing fire and smoke mastery. Seasonal Thai produce complements imported ingredients from India, adding authenticity to each dish. Highlights include black truffle cream cheese naan and flavorful lamb vindaloo.
address: 177/22 Soi Sukhumvit 39, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Besides Umi
description_full: The recently opened space at Besides Umi (stylized as BESIDES Umi) at Velaa Sindhorn is a twist on the classic omakase spot for an afterwork drink destination. The menu is divided into small plates—ranging from the simple binjin tomato in dashi jelly (B150) to the abalone with kimo sauce croquette—and sharing plates including charcoal grilled bigfin reef squid (B480). There are also individual single dishes: Yaki Inaniwa udon and an organic ground beef Japanese curry (B400). Things get serious with their sushi platters and raw bar, featuring an omakase sashimi platter and negitoro maki.
summary: A modern twist on omakase, this restaurant offers an inviting atmosphere perfect for afterwork drinks. The menu features a variety of small and sharing plates, including grilled squid and sushi platters that highlight fresh ingredients. With a focus on unique flavors and presentation, each dish is crafted to encourage sharing and conversation.
address: 87 Lang Suan Rd, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Cento
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A vibrant eatery serves up a diverse menu inspired by New Orleans cuisine, featuring flavorful dishes that satisfy every palate. Ramen specialties and homemade pizzas add to the unique offerings, making it a culinary adventure. Perfect for food lovers, the lively atmosphere enhances the dining experience.
address: 120 Soi Sala Daeng 1/1, Si Lom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Cheese and Dough
description_full: Baba’s casual Indian bites, situated in Marche Thonglor, is all about showing off their fire and smoke mastery in an upscale and cozy dining spot. For extra authenticity points, the restaurant imports key ingredients from India and uses seasonal produce from Thailand for local flair. You can start with the bitsize mimosas and pair their black truffle cream cheese naan with some spicy lamb vindaloo. The tulsi chicken tikka is just one of the dishes that this joint chooses to show off their fire.
summary: A cozy spot in Marche Thonglor, this restaurant specializes in Indian bites with a focus on fire and smoke techniques. Seasonal Thai produce complements imported ingredients from India, enhancing authenticity. Signature dishes include black truffle cream cheese naan paired with spicy lamb vindaloo.
address: 869 Phatthanakan Rd, Khwaeng Suan Luang, Khet Suan Luang, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10250, Thailand

name: Darlin You’re So Fine
description_full: This Sathon cafe is taking the saying “an apple a day keeps the doctors away” quite seriously. DYSF (short for Darlin You’re So Fine) is a two-story brunch to late night eatery serving several apple based items. From apple cranberry salad, caramelized apple bruschetta, to apple soup, who knew that apples can be so versatile! If the fruit isn't your thing, fear not, the dining spot also nails down pastas, fish and chips, and other classic brunch bites that we all know and love.
summary: A unique café in Sathon focuses on apple-inspired dishes, showcasing the fruit's versatility in salads, bruschetta, and soups. Classic brunch favorites like pasta and fish and chips complement the menu for varied tastes. With a cozy two-story layout, it’s perfect for casual dining any time of day.
address: 92 8 Thanon Naradhiwat Rajanagarindra, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Dough Bros
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A lively spot, this restaurant showcases a variety of New Orleans dishes alongside homemade pizzas and unique ramen options. Perfect for food lovers seeking new flavors, the atmosphere is casual yet vibrant. Diners can enjoy a diverse menu that caters to various tastes.
address: Interchange 21 Room 104 G. Floor 399 Sukhumvit Rd. Khlong Toei Neua, Wattana, Bangkok, 10110, Thailand

name: Dos Burros
description_full: Bangkok’s favorite Mexican food brothers, Itzco and Tlahui Calva, who have been dishing out the goodies at Missing Burro in Thonglor for years, have opened a new spot on the Southside of Thonglor, Dos Burros. This new space adds a little something special to their offerings on the other side of Thonglor—notably, breakfast, as they’re open at 8am. The breakfast menu includes the classic huevos rancheros with two sunny side up eggs and a tatemada sauce, as well as the huevos a la malagena featuring two poached eggs, shrimp, green peas, and corn tortillas. All breakfast dishes come with a coffee and freshly pressed orange juice.
summary: A vibrant new eatery brings a taste of Mexico to Thonglor. Breakfast specialties like huevos rancheros and huevos a la malagena pair perfectly with fresh coffee and orange juice. Open early at 8am, it’s an inviting spot for morning gatherings.
address: Sukhumvit 36, 2d Soi 23 7, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Earthy Society
description_full: Just when you thought Bangkok had its fill of brunch spots, another one hits the scene with a fresh take. Earthy Society came through with an ambitious MO: using their menu to introduce customers to Thai ingredients. Take their Turkish Poached Eggs which sources organic eggos all the way from Nakhon Pathom or their fish and chips menu which has a rotation of different fish every week depending on what the Lantao fishermen can catch.
summary: A fresh brunch spot in Bangkok, the menu highlights unique Thai ingredients with dishes like Turkish Poached Eggs and a rotating selection of fish and chips. The focus on organic produce creates a wholesome dining experience. Perfect for food enthusiasts looking to explore local flavors.
address: 44 Soi Pridi Banomyong 26, Khwaeng Phra Khanong Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Ega Luv Seafood
description_full: Ega, known for its experimental local Thai food menu on Songwat street, has launched its little sister project, Ega Luv Seafood. As the name suggests, the spot shines with its seafood ingredients: grilled, steamed, boiled, and baked to your delight. The sunny side galaxy shrimp platter features three huge sunny-side-up dishes surrounded with juicy shrimp.
summary: A seafood haven on Songwat street, this restaurant specializes in grilled, steamed, and baked dishes that highlight fresh ingredients. The sunny side galaxy shrimp platter is a standout, featuring three enormous sunny-side-up eggs paired with succulent shrimp. With a casual atmosphere, it's perfect for seafood lovers looking to indulge.
address: 1298, 1306 Song Wat Rd, Khwaeng Chakkrawat, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100, Thailand

name: Enishi Ramen Bangkok
description_full: This ramen specialty space has already garnered quite a following in Singapore. In the One City Centre Building (OCC), Enishi Ramen has landed in the heart of the city for Phloechit busy bees to check out their premium grade fresh noodles and broth. Try the Dan Dan Noodle (B480) packed with pork, minced duck, fried onion, over 20 kinds of spice, and an onsen tamago coating the noodles with a bit of richness.
summary: A vibrant ramen spot in One City Centre, this venue highlights premium fresh noodles and flavorful broth. Specialties include the Dan Dan Noodle, featuring pork, minced duck, and a rich onsen tamago. Perfect for busy locals seeking a satisfying meal.
address: ชั้น 2 ยูนิต R2, OCC - One City Centre, 10 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Et 1.5
description_full: Intending to run an all-day brunch eatery with a low carbon footprint, Et 1.5 gathers their produce in house. The eggs are taken from their farmed chickens, veggies are plucked from their backyard, and other ingredients are locally sourced to save the planet and your hunger pangs. For example, their organic Turkish Eggs from House Hen (B280) serves poached eggs alongside Loatian seaweed on top of homemade yogurt and cheese.
summary: A sustainable brunch spot, this eatery emphasizes a low carbon footprint with house-grown produce. Signature dishes like organic Turkish Eggs showcase locally sourced ingredients and creative flavors. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for leisurely meals any time of day.

name: Feaw
description_full: The Racquet Club might be one of Thonglor’s most frequented sport centers. Kids get their first swimming lessons and adults hit the gym or go rock climbing. To keep the post workout hangry crowd at bay, they’ve upped their food game with an in house community dining spot. Leading the charge with Feaw, the team behind R-Haan serves comfort street food like the long lasting crispy deep fried pork wonton or the reliable kaprao topped with Aussie beef.
summary: A vibrant dining spot within a sport center, this venue offers comforting street food to satisfy post-workout cravings. Signature dishes include crispy deep-fried pork wontons and kaprao topped with Aussie beef. The atmosphere is lively, making it a great place for both families and fitness enthusiasts.
address: 5, อาคารคิว ห้องเลขที่ อาร์คิว7007, Soi Sukhumvit 49/9, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Fatboy Izakaya Amarin
description_full: The city’s favorite space for Japanese food with a party vibe, Fatboy Izakaya, has finally opened another branch at the newly renovated Gaysorn Amarin, serving everyone’s grub and drinks—now with a view. Currently, they share the same menu with the Ekkamai branch but some exclusive Gaysorn additions are in the making. The crowd pleasing side snack, a bowl of crispy chicken skin (B140) is similar to pork scratching (kap moo) and maintains its crunchy texture for hours. And, of course, you just can’t resist ordering the signature Fatboy Roll (750). Coming in a platter of eight, the maki is stuffed with fresh cucumber, cream cheese, and a tender wagyu with an extra strip of thinly sliced foie gras on top.
summary: A lively spot for Japanese cuisine, this izakaya offers a vibrant atmosphere complemented by a scenic view. Specialties include crispy chicken skin and the signature Fatboy Roll, featuring fresh ingredients and luxurious toppings. Perfect for social gatherings, the venue promises a fun dining experience.
address: Gaysorn Amarin ชั้น 3 496 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Gaggan at Louis Vuitton
description_full: Louis Vuitton has entered the realm of haute cuisine with a restaurant in Ratchaprasong where fine dining and high fashion meet. The iconic brand has placed the restaurant in the skillful hands of superstar Chef Gaggan Anand, known for his creative and radical approach to progressive Indian cuisine. You’ll recognize the throughline from his previous work on this menu. The concept promises to uplift the 5S (sweet, sour, salty,spicy, and surprise).
summary: A sophisticated dining experience merges haute cuisine with luxury fashion in Ratchaprasong. Innovative dishes by Chef Gaggan Anand bring a creative twist to progressive Indian flavors, focusing on sweet, sour, salty, spicy, and surprise elements. The elegant atmosphere enhances the culinary journey.
address: Unit 2F-S01-B, Second Floor, Unit A, 5th Floor Gaysorn Amarin, 502 ถนน เพลินจิต แขวงลุมพินี เขตปทุมวัน กรุงเทพมหานคร 10330, Thailand

name: Gowin Dimsum
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A city center gem, this restaurant specializes in all-you-can-eat dim sum, featuring delights like prawn dumplings and spring rolls. With a focus on affordability, it attracts locals eager for delicious bites without breaking the bank. Perfect for casual dining, the lively atmosphere makes every meal an enjoyable experience.
address: 11/1 Thanon Sathu Pradit, Khwaeng Chong Nonsi, Khet Yan Nawa, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Grok 1970
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A vibrant eatery showcases an array of New Orleans dishes alongside exciting ramen specialties. With a focus on homemade pizza and fresh ingredients, the menu caters to diverse palates. Perfect for food lovers, the atmosphere is lively and inviting.
address: 14 Soi Somkid, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Honobono Ramen
description_full: Udom Suk residents don’t have to waste time in Thonglor and Phrom Phong traffic for a bowl of their favorite noodles because Honobono ramen brings craft ramen right to their neighborhood. The shoyu ramen (B279), a chicken shoyu broth, is mixed with some fruit de la mer. This dish is finished off with sous vide chicken breast, chashu pork, pickled bamboo shoots, and ajitama (boiled eggs marinated in sauce). Try the shio ramen (B259) for that extra aromatic flavor straight from the sea.
summary: A local gem, this ramen spot serves up craft noodles that highlight fresh ingredients. Specialties like the shoyu ramen feature a rich chicken broth with sous vide chicken and chashu pork. Perfect for a quick yet satisfying meal, the menu also includes aromatic shio ramen for seafood lovers.
address: 633 Sukhumvit 103 Rd, Khwaeng Bang Chak, Khet Phra Khanong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10260, Thailand

name: Horsamut
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A lively spot, this restaurant serves a variety of New Orleans dishes alongside unique ramen and homemade pizzas. With a focus on fresh ingredients, the menu caters to diverse tastes and cravings. Perfect for food lovers seeking something new and exciting.
address: 8 Soi Tha Kham, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand

name: Illy Cafe
description_full: Illy is already a household name with more than 160 cafes in major cities across the globe. Its Erawan branch marks the first venue in Thailand. Living up to its international reputation, the cafe provides more than your regular coffee order and serves up Italian classics from fusilli pesto to mortadella sandwiches. It also delivers on the dessert front with the multi layered coffee bean (B220), a combo of chocolate moose, coffee cake, and dark chocolate coating that’ll give the bite a crunchy-on-the-outside-fluffy-on-the-inside texture.
summary: A stylish café in Erawan, this spot offers a delightful mix of Italian classics and specialty coffees. Signature dishes include fusilli pesto and mortadella sandwiches, complemented by an indulgent multi-layered coffee bean dessert. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for both casual meet-ups and relaxed meals.
address: LG Floor, Erawan Bangkok, 494 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Jaja Bistro
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A vibrant bistro serves up a delightful mix of New Orleans cuisine and innovative ramen dishes. With a focus on homemade comforts, the atmosphere is perfect for casual dining. Unique flavors and a welcoming vibe make it a local favorite.
address: Baan Turtle, 31 Soi Suan Phlu 2, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Jharokha by Indus
description_full: Jharokha by Indus is an exciting new opening helmed by Chef Sanket Hoskote and the team behind the beloved Indus. Dishes are focused on cooking with custom charcoal kopa ovens and fusing it with Indian flavors, which includes baked to order flatbreads with additional touches of smoke. Try their buttercream king oyster mushrooms with morel mushroom gravy and Kashmiri-inspired stuffing or their Batak Seekh Kebab, a Delhi classic with spiced Korat duck mince that’s grilled on charcoal tandoor paired with pineapple chutney. The interiors are reminiscent of historical polo clubs with curved archways, grand wooden counters, and leather furnishings.
summary: A chic restaurant showcases the culinary creativity of Chef Sanket Hoskote, featuring dishes cooked in custom charcoal ovens. Signature offerings include buttercream king oyster mushrooms and charcoal-grilled Batak Seekh Kebab, highlighting Indian flavors. Elegant interiors evoke a historical charm with archways and leather furnishings, perfect for an upscale dining experience.
address: 494 Building Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Jiaozi Jiuba
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A vibrant eatery showcases authentic New Orleans cuisine with a twist. Specialties include unique ramen dishes and homemade pizzas, perfect for adventurous foodies. The lively atmosphere provides an inviting space for casual dining.
address: 4 Floor, 496 502 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Kamakiri Udon
description_full: Bangkok has had its fill of ramen restaurants, but what about the udon lovers? Kamakiri Udon delivers fresh noodles straight from Fukuoka. They exclusively serve up noodle dishes during lunch hours and transform themselves into an izakaya at night. The scene stealer is the Mentai Tororo Egg (B280), an udon bowl topped with mentaiko mixed with mashed tororo yam and a fresh egg.
summary: A cozy spot in Bangkok, fresh udon noodles from Fukuoka are served during lunch, while evenings transform into a lively izakaya. Specialties include the standout Mentai Tororo Egg, featuring creamy mentaiko and tororo yam atop a warm udon bowl. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for both casual lunches and relaxed dinners.
address: S102, Live Work Asia, 31 Sukhumvit 26, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Kataru
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: Offering a taste of New Orleans, the restaurant showcases flavorful dishes and unique ramen specialties. A relaxed atmosphere invites foodies to explore a diverse menu featuring homemade pizza and more. Ideal for casual dining, it caters to various culinary cravings.
address: 67 Soi Ekkamai 30, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Kenny’s Phrom Phong
description_full: Udom Suk residents don’t have to waste time in Thonglor and Phrom Phong traffic for a bowl of their favorite noodles because Honobono ramen brings craft ramen right to their neighborhood. The shoyu ramen (B279), a chicken shoyu broth, is mixed with some fruit de la mer. This dish is finished off with sous vide chicken breast, chashu pork, pickled bamboo shoots, and ajitama (boiled eggs marinated in sauce). Try the shio ramen (B259) for that extra aromatic flavor straight from the sea.
summary: A local favorite, this restaurant serves craft ramen that satisfies cravings without the traffic hassle. Specialties include shoyu ramen with chicken broth and sous vide chicken, along with aromatic shio ramen infused with seafood flavors. The inviting atmosphere makes it a great spot for noodle lovers in the neighborhood.
address: 24, 1 ซ. สุขุมวิท 31 Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Kokugura Ramen
description_full: For years, the downtown area has been a hub for high quality ramen, and now Ari locals are getting their very own version of that with Kokugura. The founder, chef Kulapol “Air” Samsen has honed his skills at the Michelin-star Indian restaurant Gaa and has already successfully opened the Ari neo-Chinese gem, Yoong Chang. A ramen lover himself, the chef tried out 23 world famous ramen shops in Japan. As a plus, the resto turns into a sake bar with classic Japanese grub in the evening.
summary: Ari's ramen scene thrives with a unique offering from a chef trained at Michelin-starred Gaa. Specializing in authentic Japanese flavors, the menu features exquisite ramen and transforms into a sake bar serving classic dishes by night. Cozy and inviting, this venue is perfect for both casual meals and evening relaxation.
address: 1, 7 Soi Ari 2, Phaya Thai, Khet Phaya Thai, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand

name: Kuma no Yakitori
description_full: Hailing all the way from Osaka, Kuma no Yakitori is a lauded fine dining omakase specializing in skewered chicken dishes. Their Osaka branch is a members-only club with first entry costing up to B72,00. But the new Bangkok branch is open to all. Currently serving a 16-course menu, the dishes use up almost the entire chicken, from the common crispy skin to innards, hearts, and even chicken sashimi.
summary: A fine dining experience from Osaka, this omakase specializes in creative skewered chicken dishes. With a 16-course menu that utilizes nearly every part of the chicken, expect unique flavors and textures. The casual atmosphere welcomes all diners to enjoy this culinary journey.
address: 1F, Rain Hill, 777 ซอย สุขุมวิท 47 แขวงคลองตันเหนือ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Kwann
description_full: Chef Napol “Joe”Jantraget, acclaimed for the local Samlor (Top Tables 2023 No. 14), has teamed up with Chef Jirapat “Sept” Praphotjanaporn of Nawa, to launch Kwann, a brand new project filled with Thai fine dining firewood delectables. Since the ingredients are mostly sourced from local producers across the regions, the menu is ever-evolving depending on the seasonal ingredients. The Thai Wagyu Beef Tartare with their jasmine rice charcoal crackers (B720) can make fans out of raw meat skeptics. It features diced Nong Khai tenderloin, tender but slightly chewy and subverts the gaminess with traditional herbs, leaning towards a mild zesty yum flavor. Above the fiery concept is the intention to have fun and experiment with varying ingredients. What you have on the first visit, might not be there in the next.
summary: A vibrant dining spot, Kwann showcases Thai fine dining with a focus on seasonal ingredients sourced from local producers. Signature dishes include the Thai Wagyu Beef Tartare, which surprises with its fresh flavors and unique presentation. Expect an ever-changing menu that encourages culinary exploration and experimentation.
address: 73/7-8, Soi Sukhumvit 13, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Long John Silver’s
description_full: The American fast food seafood chain has finally arrived on Bangkok’s shores. Named for the pirate in “Treasure Island” and a mainstay in American fast food with more than 500 locations,  they’re serving up de la mer classics and fried chicken. Since this might be uncharted territory for a lot of Thai fans, we recommend a safe bet like the fish combo set (B189) which is Long John Silver’s version of crispy fish and chips. Their Bucket Shrimp (B179) is coated with a special signature seasoning while the Chicken and Shrimp combo (B179) adds fried chicken alongside some waffle fries.
summary: A casual seafood chain, this venue introduces American fast food favorites to Bangkok. Signature dishes include the crispy fish combo and seasoned bucket shrimp, perfect for those looking to explore new flavors. The inviting atmosphere makes it a great spot for a quick meal or casual gathering.
address: ชั้น 2, Megabangna, 38 หมู่ที่ 6 Thanon Bang Na-Trat Frontage, Tambon Bang Kaeo, Amphoe Bang Phli, Chang Wat Samut Prakan 10540, Thailand

name: Mickey’s Diner
description_full: Chalee Kader, BK Magazine’s Top Tables Chef of the Year for 2023 and the star behind Michelin star venues like Wanayook and 100 Mahaseth has opened up an American style diner and haven of hearty meals. The menu is inspired by Kader’s time in San Francisco. It eschews trend-focused, aesthetically pleasing Instagram brunch while still bringing out the classics with fried chicken and waffles (B513), and Mickey’s breakfast (B363) with Canadian bacon, sunny-side-up eggs, homemade fries, pork sausage patty, and pancake.
summary: A cozy diner serves hearty American meals inspired by San Francisco. Fried chicken and waffles alongside a classic breakfast featuring Canadian bacon and homemade fries highlight the menu. The ambiance is relaxed, perfect for casual dining.
address: GF Floor, Amarin Plaza, Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Nila
description_full: From Inndee to Jharokha, Indian fine dining has gotten a big boost in recent years—in particular coastal flavors that Bangkok just loves at places like Jhol. Now, Nila is the new kid on the block, found at the plush Amari Bangkok, and with the talents of Chef Bharath S Bhat.The tasting menu is coastal with a special emphasis on Goan food, the west coast tourist haven famous for its use of seafood, coconuts, and spice.
summary: A new addition to Bangkok's dining scene, this restaurant specializes in Goan coastal cuisine, showcasing fresh seafood and rich spices. Chef Bharath S Bhat crafts a tasting menu that highlights the vibrant flavors of the west coast. Set within the elegant Amari Bangkok, the atmosphere is refined yet welcoming.
address: 847 Thanon Phetchaburi, Khwaeng Thanon Phaya Thai, Khet Ratchathewi, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400, Thailand

name: Onggi
description_full: Onggi is Korean for earthenware, a container that’s essential to fermented Korean goodies. It is also the name of Injin Kim’s  passion project who aims to introduce authentic fermented Korean ingredients in a fine dining setting. Propped up in the 55th floor of Empire Tower, you’ll catch a breathtaking view along with tantalizing spread.
summary: Set on the 55th floor of Empire Tower, this restaurant offers a stunning view alongside its focus on authentic fermented Korean cuisine. A passion project by Injin Kim, the menu showcases traditional ingredients presented in a fine dining context. Perfect for food enthusiasts, the atmosphere combines elegance with cultural depth.
address: Level 55, EA, Empire Tower, 1 S Sathon Rd, Khwaeng Yan Nawa, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Ore
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: New Orleans flavors shine through a vibrant menu that includes ramen and homemade pizza. A lively atmosphere makes this restaurant perfect for foodies seeking unique culinary experiences. Seasonal specialties keep the offerings fresh and exciting.
address: 11 31 Thanon Sathu Pradit, Khwaeng Chong Nonsi, Khet Yan Nawa, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: The Pablo Bangkok
description_full: Inspired by South American dining, The Pablo has established a new all-day dining concept on the busy corner street of Asoke. The king of the brunch hours is, as ever, the eggs benny (B430). While the Pablo Breakfast Plate (B450) is loaded with fresh sauteed veggies and scrambled eggs, both quite mild in flavor, allowing the spicy sausage and uber-thick slice of bacon to do the talking.
summary: A vibrant all-day dining spot on Asoke, this restaurant highlights South American flavors. Signature dishes include the flavorful eggs benny and a hearty breakfast plate featuring fresh veggies and rich bacon. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for brunch lovers seeking a relaxed vibe.
address: 2 Soi Sukhumvit 25, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Pah Jong
description_full: Pah Jong is the latest from the chef at “00 Pasta” with over 64 combinations of fried rice. Start your custom-made dish by selecting from the four available bases: jasmine rice, Japanese rice, sticky rice, and basmati rice. After that, you can pick form 16 types of sauce ranging from squid ink, mala, to truffle.
summary: A unique dining experience awaits with over 64 fried rice combinations. Customization starts with your choice of jasmine, Japanese, sticky, or basmati rice, followed by an array of 16 sauces like squid ink and truffle. The focus on personal touches makes each dish a flavorful adventure.
address: 169 Thanon Samsen, Khwaeng Wat Sam Phraya, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200, Thailand

name: Rangoon Tea House
description_full: The Racquet Club might be one of Thonglor’s most frequented sport centers. Kids get their first swimming lessons and adults hit the gym or go rock climbing. To keep the post workout hangry crowd at bay, they’ve upped their food game with an in house community dining spot. Leading the charge with Feaw, the team behind R-Haan serves comfort street food like the long lasting crispy deep fried pork wonton or the reliable kaprao topped with Aussie beef.
summary: A vibrant community dining spot within a sports center, this venue offers comfort street food favorites. Specialties include crispy deep-fried pork wontons and kaprao topped with Australian beef. Perfect for post-workout cravings, the atmosphere is casual and welcoming.
address: 6 Soi Sangchai, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Roberta's
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A vibrant eatery known for its homemade pizzas and New Orleans-inspired dishes, the atmosphere buzzes with creativity. Unique culinary offerings and a casual vibe make it perfect for food enthusiasts seeking something different. Enjoy a laid-back meal in a space that feels both welcoming and eclectic.
address: Unit 301, Siam Discovery, 989 Rama I Rd, Khwaeng Pathum Wan, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Ruay Mitr (Ekkamai)
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A vibrant spot for New Orleans cuisine, this restaurant showcases a menu filled with flavorful dishes that cater to diverse palates. With a lively atmosphere perfect for gatherings, guests can enjoy unique ramen specialties and freshly made pizza. The inviting ambiance pairs well with the creative culinary offerings.
address: 26 Sukhumvit 61, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Sababa
description_full: From F&B pioneers attached to names like Gigi and Iron Balls, comes Sababa, a fusion blend of Mediterranean izakaya tucked away in a home-y lush patch of eden in Thonglor 13. Chef Maxim Baile leads the kitchen, churning out Mediterranean, Japanese, and some Middle Eastern dishes meant for sharing with a crowd of friends and family.You can expect everything from fresh oysters to crispy chicken skin. If you’re planning to go all out for dinner, order their Pistachio Carbonara (B490) with bits of pancetta and asparagus tips. Other highlights include the Challans Chicken Couscous (B840) and the Italian standard Beef Tongue Milanaise (B460).
summary: A cozy fusion restaurant offers a unique blend of Mediterranean and Japanese dishes perfect for sharing. Highlights include the Pistachio Carbonara and crispy chicken skin, all set in a lush, homey atmosphere. Ideal for gatherings with friends and family in Thonglor.
address: 53 S. Torsak Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Smizzle (Ari)
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A vibrant spot for food lovers, the restaurant showcases a variety of New Orleans specialties alongside unique ramen dishes. Homemade pizzas and a rotating selection of seasonal offerings create a menu that excites every palate. With its warm atmosphere, it's perfect for casual dining or a lively meal with friends.
address: 695 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Street Pizza
description_full: A little further down the bustling Thonglor streets and the fertile ground for cafes in Pridi, Pattanakarn is an untapped location for restaurants. As the name suggests, it’s all about the pizza at this spot. We recommend the classic margherita (B299) made from sourdough marinated up to 36 hours before using. The slices render a soft and fluffy feel which bodes well with their sweet tomato base and fresh basil.
summary: A hidden gem in Thonglor, this restaurant specializes in sourdough pizza with a soft, fluffy texture. The classic margherita features a sweet tomato base and fresh basil, making it a delightful choice. Perfect for casual dining, the atmosphere is relaxed and inviting.
address: PHJ8+VM9 Emsphere Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Sushi Kuuya
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A modern sushi spot, the restaurant showcases a variety of fresh rolls and traditional dishes. Known for its vibrant atmosphere, it invites diners to enjoy artfully presented meals in a stylish setting. Perfect for sushi enthusiasts, the menu emphasizes quality ingredients and innovative flavors.
address: 2F Vivre Langsuan 34/3 Soi Langsuan, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Take Eat Easy
description_full: Intending to run an all-day brunch eatery with a low carbon footprint, Et 1.5 gathers their produce in house. The eggs are taken from their farmed chickens, veggies are plucked from their backyard, and other ingredients are locally sourced to save the planet and your hunger pangs. For example, their organic Turkish Eggs from House Hen (B280) serves poached eggs alongside Loatian seaweed on top of homemade yogurt and cheese.
summary: A sustainable eatery focuses on all-day brunch with locally sourced ingredients. Specialties include organic Turkish Eggs featuring poached eggs and homemade yogurt, highlighting fresh produce from their own farm. The commitment to a low carbon footprint enhances the dining experience, making it both delicious and eco-friendly.
address: 19 Thanon Yen Akat, Khwaeng Chong Nonsi, Khet Yan Nawa, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Tapori
description_full: Tapori, hindu slang for wanderer, takes diners beyond the cliche Indian cuisine, mining recipes from a more than 300 recipe database and narrowing it down to a top 29 first issue. We recommend the tawa-masala kaleji (B420). Traditionally found in Delhi weddings, the north meets south dish is a chicken liver flavored ice cream eaten on a bed of dosa crumble. Also order the milky ice cream benami kheer (B350) and take a stab at guessing the secret ingredient.
summary: A unique dining experience showcases a curated selection of Indian dishes, pulling from over 300 recipes. Specialties like tawa-masala kaleji and milky ice cream benami kheer offer unexpected flavors. Perfect for adventurous eaters, the menu invites culinary exploration.
address: 22, 2 Soi 47, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Tina's
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: New Orleans flavors shine at this vibrant eatery, offering a mix of ramen specialties and homemade pizzas. With a focus on fresh ingredients, the menu caters to diverse palates and adventurous foodies. The lively atmosphere makes it perfect for casual dining with friends or family.
address: 7 Thanon Suan Phlu, Khwaeng Thung Maha Mek, Khet Sathon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10120, Thailand

name: Tokki
description_full: Tokki is a Korean restaurant and bar that’s not casual nor fine dining but a good in-between. The name translates to "rabbit," a term that appears throughout the restaurant. The space has plenty of indoor plants with a minimalist and neutral tone. The menu showsoff the playful side of Korean dining, like the Corn Kimchi Jeon, Korean pizza generously coated with cheese and corn; Snow Yukke, fried seaweed with marinated beef, topped with egg yolk and cheese; and their Bulgogi Fries featuring sweet marinated pork on top of thick fries. They also do Korean traditional liquor pairings which include honey coconut makgeolli with honeycomb and soju highballs.
summary: A stylish Korean restaurant and bar offers a delightful mix of playful dishes like Corn Kimchi Jeon and Bulgogi Fries. Indoor plants enhance the minimalist vibe, creating a welcoming atmosphere for diners. Traditional liquor pairings elevate the experience, making it perfect for casual gatherings.
address: 4th Floor, Donki mall, Soi Sukhumvit 63, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Unagi Yondaime Kikukawa
description_full: Blink and we’re well past the mid-way point of 2024. To fuel you through the remaining months, we’ve compiled 50 hot new restaurants that have opened since the beginning of the year—a list for every type of foodie. BK is serving up New Orleans fare, hot new ramen specialties, homemade ‘za, and more. Scroll for your top picks.
summary: A spot for authentic ramen lovers, this restaurant offers a selection of traditional and innovative dishes. The inviting atmosphere is perfect for both casual meals and special occasions. Specialties include rich broths and handmade noodles that highlight the craft of Japanese cuisine.
address: The EmQuartier, 5A03, 6Fl, The HELIX SKY DINING, 693 ถ. สุขุมวิท แขวงคลองตันเหนือ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Leave a Comment
description_full:

summary: A vibrant new spot, this restaurant offers a selection of unique dishes crafted with fresh ingredients. Diners can enjoy a relaxed atmosphere perfect for socializing or unwinding after a long day. Specialties include innovative takes on traditional favorites that delight the palate.
address: Bangkok, Thailand

name: May Veggie Home
description_full: Serving 100-percent vegan food since 2011, this peaceful alcove on busy Ratchadaphisek Road has long been a favorite spot among the city’s health-focused crowd. It specializes in regional dishes, like plant-based panang curry, somtam platters with crunchy tofu sticks, and khao soi with tofu and mushrooms. There’s a small selection of burgers and Japanese dishes on the menu, too.8 Ratchadapisek Rd., .  daily 10:30am-9pm
summary: A peaceful alcove in the heart of Ratchadaphisek offers a fully vegan menu that delights health-conscious diners. Specialties include plant-based panang curry and khao soi with tofu and mushrooms, alongside a selection of burgers and Japanese dishes. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for casual meals any day of the week.
address: 45 ประสานมิตรพลาซ่า ชั้น 2, Soi Sukhumvit 23, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Plantiful
description_full: by a UCLA graduate, this pet-friendly cafe offers scientifically-backed dishes free from refined sugar, chemicals, and preservatives. Their menu ranges from noodle dishes like the spicy kimchi soba (B 61, .  daily 8am-5pm
summary: A pet-friendly café offers scientifically-backed dishes free from refined sugar and preservatives. The menu highlights unique noodle options like spicy kimchi soba, perfect for health-conscious diners. With a welcoming atmosphere, it's ideal for casual meals any day of the week.
address: GF Floor, Amarin Plaza, Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Bonita Cafe and Social Club
description_full: Functioning as a hub for runners all over Bangkok, this vegan cafe and social club has long advocated the benefits of a healthy vegan diet, exercise, and rest. The comforting Studio Ghibli-esque interiors make this cafe a good place to kick back and relax with like-minded people. While service can be a little slow, the wide range of dishes, including the Japanese curry with brown rice (B 26, .  Wed-Mon 9:30am-9:30pm
summary: A cozy vegan café and social club attracts health-conscious locals and runners alike. Comforting Studio Ghibli-inspired interiors create a relaxed atmosphere, perfect for enjoying dishes like Japanese curry with brown rice. Friendly vibes and a focus on wellness make it an inviting spot to unwind.
address: 100 Soi Pramote (Silom Soi 26), Silom, แขวงสุริยวงศ์ Bang Rak, Bangkok 10500, Thailand

name: Veganerie
description_full: Bangkok’s best-loved vegan bakery blooms into a full-blown restaurant at this modern-rustic spot. The plant-based dishes span everything from “pulled pork” burgers made with mushrooms to sweet potato and chickpea coconut curries. Desserts remain a specialty, with a menu touting vegan waffles, cashew nut cheesecakes, and Nutella frappes that look anything but dairy-free.Sukhumvit Soi 11, .  daily 10am-10pm
summary: A modern-rustic vegan restaurant offers a diverse menu featuring dishes like mushroom burgers and coconut curries. Desserts are a standout, showcasing vegan waffles and cashew cheesecakes that delight even non-vegans. Perfect for plant-based enthusiasts, the inviting atmosphere encourages relaxed dining any time of day.
address: 35 2 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Nourish Cafe
description_full: A place to stop after heavy training at Bangkok Fight Lab, the conveniently located, plant-based Nourish Cafe offers fresh, whole, unprocessed ingredient-based foods. The energy-replenishing mains and desserts, ranging from the barbecue jackfruit burger (B 50, .  Mon-Fri 9am-10pm, Sat-Sun 9am-3pm
summary: A plant-based café near Bangkok Fight Lab offers fresh, whole foods ideal for post-workout recovery. Specialties include energy-boosting mains like the barbecue jackfruit burger. With a welcoming vibe, it's a perfect spot to recharge after training sessions.
address: 137, Bangkok Fight Lab - Jiu-Jitsu MMA & Muay Thai, 50 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Vistro
description_full: This two-story vegan bistro exudes positive vibes from the moment you ascend the bright staircase. Green plants and natural light provide the setting for vibrant and creative dishes, ranging from kimchi-dilla (B 24, .  daily Sun-Thu 10am-9:30pm, Fri-Sat 10am-9pm.
summary: A vibrant vegan bistro welcomes guests with bright decor and lush greenery. Creative dishes like kimchi-dilla highlight a menu focused on fresh ingredients, making each meal feel special. Perfect for a casual lunch or dinner, the inviting atmosphere encourages relaxation and enjoyment.
address: 46/1 Soi Sukhumvit 24, Klongton Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Pimp My Salad
description_full: Sathorn’s salad specialist doesn’t skimp on its ingredients. Think packed acai bowls (B 8, .  daily 8am-8pm.
summary: A vibrant spot in Sathorn, this restaurant focuses on fresh, wholesome salads and acai bowls. Bright and inviting, the space is perfect for health-conscious diners looking for a quick bite or a leisurely meal. Open daily from 8 AM to 9:30 PM, it caters to both early risers and evening visitors.
address: 56, 58 Soi Sathon 8, Si Lom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Broccoli Revolution
description_full: This brick-walled, plant-based institution in Thonglor brings the green in dishes like broccoli-quinoa burgers (B 49, .  daily 10am-10pm.
summary: A brick-walled, plant-based eatery exudes a relaxed vibe perfect for health-conscious diners. Signature dishes include flavorful broccoli-quinoa burgers that showcase creativity in vegetarian cuisine. Open daily from 10 AM to 10 PM, the space invites patrons to enjoy wholesome meals in a casual setting.
address: 899 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Na Aroon
description_full: Tucked inside Ariyasom Villa hotel, this restaurant is an elegant mix of chandelier, tall windows, and dark teak accents. The menu presents vegetarian Thai dishes, with seafood being the only non-vegetarian option. Opt for the tom yum hed (tom yum soup with fresh mushrooms, B 1 Alley, .  daily 7am-10pm
summary: Set within the charming Ariyasom Villa, the restaurant features elegant decor with chandeliers and teak accents. Specializing in vegetarian Thai cuisine, it offers a unique tom yum soup with fresh mushrooms as a standout dish. Perfect for a serene dining experience, the ambiance is both relaxing and sophisticated.
address: 65 สุขุมวิท ซ. 1 Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Barefood
description_full: Ekkamai’s vegan-friendly deli and eatery sells a range of plant-based nut cheeses, preserved veggies, kombucha, and more. You can also drop in for a plant-based burger, made from zucchini, beetroot, mushrooms, and rice flour and topped with cashew nut jack cheese; rice bowls made with organic riceberry; or fresh lasagna. The space often hosts workshops and events on weekends, too. 61, .  Tue-Sun 11:30am-9.30pm
summary: A vegan-friendly deli in Ekkamai offers a variety of plant-based nut cheeses, kombucha, and hearty meals like zucchini burgers and organic rice bowls. The inviting atmosphere is perfect for casual dining or taking part in workshops on weekends. Enjoy fresh lasagna and other creative dishes while embracing a healthy lifestyle.
address: 5 Soi. Raewadee 64 TaladKwan, Muang Amphoe Mueang Nonthaburi, Chang Wat Nonthaburi 11000, Thailand

name: Anotai
description_full: Here you’ll find a more sophisticated vibe than most veggie places, plus expert-cooking by the eponymous chef, who uses fresh produce from her own farm, Rai Plook Rak, in Ratchaburi. Mostly Thai, the menu spans both tofu dishes and texturized vegetable protein (fake meat). Try the tamarind chili fried rice with salted egg (B Rama 9 Hospital, .  daily 10am-9pm
summary: A sophisticated vegetarian restaurant offers expertly crafted dishes using fresh produce from its own farm. The menu features both traditional Thai options and innovative takes, such as tamarind chili fried rice with salted egg. With a warm atmosphere, it's perfect for those seeking flavorful plant-based cuisine.
address: 976/17 Rama IX Rd, Khwaeng Bang Kapi, Khet Huai Khwang, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10310, Thailand

name: Saras Veg
description_full: Saras has all the charms and follies of a backstreet Indian diner: colorful clientele; long menu that includes simple favorites you never see at proper restaurants; cobbled but timely service; deliciously unhealthy food. Dishes are all vegetarian and spiced without caution—the ever-popular paneer dosa (dosa stuffed with cottage cheese, B 20, .  Mon-Fri 11am-10:30pm, Sat 10am-10:30pm, Sun 10am-11:30pm
summary: A lively Indian diner offers a vibrant atmosphere with a colorful clientele. Vegetarian dishes are generously spiced, featuring favorites like the paneer dosa. Service is friendly and casual, making it a great spot for comfort food lovers.
address: 15 Soi Sukhumvit 20, Khwaeng Khlong Toei, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Govinda
description_full: Save the portrait of the restaurant’s namesake on the second floor, it’s all shelves of Italian cookbooks and warm-colored walls here. Perusing the menu, you might not realize that Govinda serves an all-vegetarian, partially lactose-free menu—an impressive feat for Italian food in this town. The menu covers all our favorite Italian dishes, including egg-free, homemade cannelloni (B  Rd., .  Mon, Wed-Fri 12pm-3pm, 5pm-10pm. Sat-Sun 12pm-10pm
summary: A warm, inviting space filled with Italian cookbooks offers a unique all-vegetarian menu that surprises with classic flavors. Specialties include homemade, egg-free cannelloni, perfect for those seeking vegetarian options without compromising taste. The cozy atmosphere makes it an ideal spot for relaxed dining any time of day.
address: 6/5-6 Sukhumvit Soi 22, Khwaeng Khlong Tan, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Suananda
description_full: This hidden sanctuary of wellness and healing serves homemade vegetarian food in a peaceful garden tucked off the main road, where Indian owner Sukesh also runs yoga and healthy cooking classes. The menu is mainly Indian, spotlighting seasonal organic crops, with highlights including some delectable, charitable lunch sets like the Love Thy Neighbor set (Burmese khao soi with chickpea tofu and semolina coconut barfi, B245) and Punjabi Desi Dhaba (paneer and pea curry with mint, salad, and raita, B295), which provides a meal for another, less privileged individual for every set ordered.109/9 Pan Rd., .  Wed-Mon 10:30am-9:30pm
summary: A hidden sanctuary offers homemade vegetarian dishes in a tranquil garden setting. Seasonal Indian specialties shine, with charitable lunch sets that provide meals for those in need. Perfect for wellness seekers, the venue also hosts yoga and cooking classes.
address: 109 Thanon Pan, Si Lom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500, Thailand

name: Saravana Bhavan
description_full: Boldly declaring itself the “world’s no.  19, .  daily 8am-10:30pm
summary: A vibrant Indian vegetarian restaurant chain, it offers a vast menu featuring iconic dishes like Mysore masala dosa and sambar vada. Known for its casual atmosphere, locals often liken it to their version of fast food. Open daily, it's perfect for quick meals or family gatherings.
address: Boldly declaring itself the “world’s no. 1 Indian vegetarian restaurant chain,” this restaurant boasts over 100 branches around the world. The restaurant’s ubiquity in its home state of Tamil Nadu, in India’s South, means locals often refer to it as their version of McDonald’s. The menu is gargantuan and includes Mysore masala dosa (red chili chutney spread on thin rice and dosa filled with mashed potatoes and onions, B210) as well as sambar vada (deep-fried lentil donuts set in lentil sambar and garnished with onions and coriander, B175).663, Baan Silom Arcade, 2/F, Silom Soi 19, 02-635-4556. Open daily 8am-10:30pm

name: Hummus Boutique
description_full: This all-Mediterranean, all-vegetarian venture comes decked out in warm woods and patterned tiles. The signature chickpea dip is elevated with tons of toppings and styles. Try the Chickpeas Brulee (B Rd, .  daily 11:30am-9:30pm.
summary: Warm woods and patterned tiles create a welcoming atmosphere in this all-Mediterranean, vegetarian restaurant. Signature chickpea dips come with a variety of toppings, showcasing creative flavors. The unique Chickpeas Brulee is a standout dish worth trying.
address: NO.64 Sukhumvit 51 Klongtan Nua Sub-district, แขวงคลองตันเหนือ เขตวัฒนา กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110, Thailand

name: Baan Tepa
description_full: Over the past three years, few restaurants in Bangkok have grown and evolved to the same degree as Baan Tepa. What started as a humble 12-seat chef’s table in a previously abandoned ancestral house is now a sprawling, sleek urban farm, cafe, and fine-dining restaurant with a 40-person cooking team. Chef Chudaree “Tam” Debhakam’s almost zealous approach to zero waste and local produce (much of it sourced from the backyard urban garden, more still from farms around Thailand), combined with a menu that is both unique and familiar, put her restaurant in a category of one. The setting matches the theme just as much as the food. The old family house has been reborn with sleek polished woods, soft lighting and splashes of green accents to hint at the urban farm philosophy. Vintage knick-knacks rub shoulders with bold abstract paintings as a mix of old and new pop tunes fill the air. It’s a rejuvenated, cozy space that isn’t afraid to blend old and new worlds. The food and experience at Baan Tepa is special. The restaurant is firing on all cylinders right now, and you will be hard pressed to find a better fine dining experience in Bangkok. This is well worth the dusty trip out to Ramkhamhaeng road. 2369, Ramkhamhaeng Rd., .  Wed-Sun 5pm-late.
summary: A sleek urban farm and fine-dining restaurant, this venue showcases a commitment to zero waste and local produce. The cozy setting blends vintage decor with modern touches, creating an inviting atmosphere for diners. Unique dishes crafted from garden-fresh ingredients make each meal a memorable experience.
address: 561 Ramkhamhaeng Rd, Khwaeng Hua Mak, Khet Bang Kapi, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10240, Thailand

name: Phed Mark
description_full: This review took place in July 2023 and is based on a visit to the restaurant without the restaurant's knowledge. For more on BK's review policy, click here.
summary: A vibrant restaurant offering a blend of local flavors and modern cuisine. Specialties include innovative dishes made with fresh ingredients, creating a delightful dining experience. The inviting atmosphere makes it perfect for both casual meals and special occasions.
address: 300 Sukhumvit Rd, Khwaeng Phra Khanong, Khet Khlong Toei, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Inddee
description_full: A century-old building and a stellar wine list with creative cuisine. The buzz: Bangkok is no stranger to Indian fine dining—Gaggan, Jhol, Gaa—and this new spot in Langsuan is hosting a whole new crowd for creative eats spanning the subcontinent, with a focus on ingredients and complex flavors that aren’t afraid to get a little spicy. The vibe: It’s big. The smooth, warm design in the century-old Langsuan home seats fifty and is already drawing booked out nights on the weekends. You walk through the doors surrounded by a foggy jungle garden. As you walk in, you’re met by a deep open kitchen and bar seating, with actual fog machines playing against the glass walls. The interior and exterior are beset by curving arches and an impressively lit ceiling on the second floor that gives it a sort of futuristic, mid-century modern appeal. The food: The fare comes from the mind of charismatic head chef Sachin Poojary, with a dining experience that spans the entire subcontinent. The seven-course tasting menu (B3,200) gets off to a delectably nutty start with a Kashmiri morel with khoya and nuts—a real highlight to start things off. The drinks: This a pairing that’s hard not to notice. Storing more than 600 bottles, the pairing is curated by sommelier Thanakorn “Jay” Bottorff featuring a broad, creative range of bottles—including a favorite in the sweet Leeu Passant Stellenbosch Chardonnay—as well as a late meal pairing of a mix of wines with umeshu to kick off your dessert.
summary: A vibrant Indian fine dining experience unfolds in a century-old home featuring creative dishes from across the subcontinent. With a striking design that includes foggy jungle gardens and a deep open kitchen, the atmosphere is both inviting and modern. A curated wine list of over 600 bottles complements the adventurous seven-course tasting menu, ensuring a memorable culinary journey.
address: 68, 1 Soi Langsuan, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

name: Hakata Tempura Nagaoka Ekkamai
description_full: The buzz: When you first hear about Hakata Tempura Nagaoka, Ekkamai’s Japanese tempura specialist, you may be mistaken for thinking it’s a high-end omakase-style chef’s table restaurant. This place, however, is a pleasant surprise with its genuinely affordable pricing, offering its crisp tempura starting from a little over a hundred baht.  The vibe: Like many other authentic Japanese spots in Bangkok, Hakata Tempura Nagaoka foregoes the formalities of lavish design for minimalist wooden decor, with the exception of its whimsically adorable illustrations of the fried shrimp hanging at its front door. The venue has only a few seats at the bar where you can see the chef put battered ingredients in to fry.  The food: The restaurant’s owner, Kazauki Shiroma, ran his first branch of Hakata Tempura Nagaoka in Fukuoka alongside his brother for 13 years, garnering a solid fanbase back home. Here, Shiroma sizzles each order in bubbling oil, monitoring constantly for temperature and serves them as soon as they’re fried. We loved the shrimp tempura (B80) served with three types of salt: curry spiced, Himalayan, and housemade tea salt—each providing a unique experience. Next up is the Wagyu Tempura (B250) in which Shiroma uses the kainomi beef cut from the Yamagata prefecture, coating it with a thin layer of batter. The result is a beautifully cooked wagyu with a tender, juicy interior which tastes exquisite when dipped in salt. Another fancier dish on the offer is the uni tempura (B450). Sourcing murasaki sea urchin, Shiroma delivers a decadent, melt-in-your mouth experience which can rival high-quality ingredients served in posh restaurants. Initially puzzled by the inclusion of rice dishes at tempura restaurant—and requests from customers—Shiroma introduced horse crab claypot rice (B500), featuring a massive portion of seafood to share among three. If you have a sweet tooth for Japanese desserts, you can either choose to relish in apple tempura (B150) served with vanilla ice cream or indulge in a decadent French toast tempura (B150). Our favorite was the daifuku strawberry (B250), a half-cut strawberry wrapped in sweet red bean paste, battered and deep-fried. Just remember to let it cool down to avoid the hot bean paste burn.  Why we’d come back: With the quality and level of attentiveness Shiroma brings to the table—along with the variety of his creative offerings for affordable prices—it’s difficult not to fall for Hakata Tempura Nagaoko. If you love tempura, this is by far one of the best spots in Bangkok. By Porpor Leelasestaporn        Photo: Porpor Leelasestaporn
summary: A minimalist wooden decor sets the stage for an authentic tempura experience, where every dish is crafted with care. Specialties include shrimp and Wagyu tempura, each expertly fried and served with unique salts. The cozy bar seating allows diners to watch the chef at work, making it a delightful spot for tempura lovers.
address: 345 Soi Sukhumvit 63, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Kenny's
description_full: The buzz: While there are many places to eat and drink in the residential Ari area, Kenny’s sets itself apart by offering comfort food done well and with a twist. They also stay open from 10am until 3am for the night owls with the midnight munchies. The vibe: From the look outside, this spot might seem just like another neighborhood restaurant but there’s something about them that’s quite inviting. Maybe it’s the logo of a friendly looking cartoon boy, or their cozy looking interiors that split into two floors with the mezzanine overlooking the first floor. But once you take a step inside, you could feel the casualty and that there won’t be any judgment if you want to eat your pizza with ketchup. The food: The pizza game is strong here and the beef burger (B290) is also a must-try. For pizza, get the Smoked It Every Day (B390) with smoked fior di latte, smoked peppered bacon from Larder, red onion, egg, and extra virgin olive oil. You’ve never had toppings like this before, combining smoked cheese, smoked bacon, and the smoke from their oven. On the side, grab the addictive Lays(zy) chips (B120), homemade chips similar to the packets of chips you buy but way tastier (and fresh). Our favorite has to be the corn ribs served with spicy marinara (B180). Crispy baby kale chicken salad (B320) is also a healthier option for those watching their weight. If you don’t feel like pizza or burgers, the baked meatball and cheese with spicy marinara is a good alternative (pork B190/beef B220) The drinks: One of the minds behind this cozy neighborhood restaurant comes from Smiling Mad Dog, one of the biggest craft beer importers in Thailand, so their beer selection isn’t here to play. You’ll get all the favorites like Brewdog Hazy Jane (B320), To Ol City Session IPA (B320), Heart Of Darkness Dream Alone (B260), and the BrewDog Punk IPA on tap (B220). On top of that, you also get a selection of earthy and casual wines like the fun Australian Press + Bloom (Sauvignon Blanc B1,990/Pinot noir B1,990) Why we’d come back: If you’ve walked through Ari before, you know it’s not exactly a pleasant sojourn. With Kenny’s, you mostly walk on the main road, so this spot is easy to get to. Twenty minutes on the train from downtown Bangkok and a four-minute walk from BTS Ari, you’re in a whole new neighborhood with cheaper drinks and food.
summary: A cozy neighborhood spot, comfort food shines with creative twists on pizzas and burgers. The inviting two-floor space encourages casual dining, making it perfect for late-night cravings. A diverse craft beer selection enhances the relaxed atmosphere, ideal for unwinding after a long day.
address: 12, 5 ถ. พหลโยธิน Phayathai, เขตพญาไท กรุงเทพมหานคร 10400, Thailand

name: Quickie
summary: A lively eatery with a casual vibe, Quickie specializes in quick bites and comfort food. Diners can enjoy a variety of flavorful dishes that cater to diverse tastes. Perfect for a laid-back meal, the atmosphere invites friends and families alike.
address: 256 Soi Thong Lo 8, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Macha
description_full: The buzz: Meandering through the residential lanes of Thonglor Soi 19, you may stumble upon a hidden gem with an irresistibly allure: Macha. This recently opened Korean casual dining venue blends the warmth of intimate Korean classics with a playful twist.  The vibe: Stepping into this cozy three-storey building, you'll feel as though you've been transported to the heart of a quintessential Korean home, from the welcoming white cushioned sofa and dark-wood accents to the delightfully warm orange hue walls. Following the elegant wooden staircase, you'll be led to a spacious second-floor retreat, where the lush, leafy ferns and abundance of natural light enhance the comfortable and inviting ambience. The food:  Despite having macha in the name, the venue doesn’t have anything to do with Japanese green tea. Rather, this place drew inspiration from pojangmacha, the plastic-curtained moving food carts of Korean streets. The owner and young culinary graduate Seokhoon Kang seeks to echo the comfort of these street food carts while offering playful twists to Korean classic dishes. He tells BK that he always dreamt of gently defying conventions when he got his first restaurant. The jangjorim bibim-myon (B240)—a hearty, cold pasta featuring simmering soy-braised beef shredded into chewy strands—brims with umami-rich sweetness. Another highly-praised dish, macha tteokbokki (B320), boasts a large pot of simmered rice cake bathed in gochujang-rich sauce, sausages, and fish cakes that we initially mistook for meatballs. Though not a fan of Korean rice cakes, their addictive quality grows with each bite. Fans of Korean fried chicken can’t miss his macha chicken (B330), a pot of sweet, crispy fried chicken combined with the delicate glaze of sticky, honey-like sweetness and gentle heat. But the real top-notch dish is his French toast (B250); the delicately crisp outer layers—not too sweet or buttery—give way to a pillowy, luscious interior stuffed with custardy kaya. This may sound like an exaggeration, but the dish surpasses other brunch spots that sell this for B300+ for the same offerings.  Why we’d come back: Macha sets itself apart from the typical fusion establishments that, more often than not, value style over substance. With its delightfully intimate ambiance and refreshing take on Korean cuisine, we’re more than confident that Macha will be crowded with food enthusiasts in no time. By Porpor Leelasestaporn
summary: A cozy, three-storey venue offers a warm atmosphere reminiscent of a Korean home, complete with inviting decor and ample natural light. Specialties include playful twists on Korean classics like jangjorim bibim-myon and addictive macha tteokbokki. Ideal for casual dining, the menu showcases unique dishes that highlight comfort and creativity in every bite.
address: 53 Soi Thong Lo 19, Khwaeng Khlong Tan Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Resonance
description_full: The buzz: If you're a frequent patron of haute cuisine in Bangkok, borderless menus may not be such an original concept with the influx of new wave chef’s tables that emerged during the pandemic—which could be impressive or meh. But among that new wave was Resonance, a borderless fine dining institute tucked away on Sukhumvit Soi 65 where each dish exudes inexplicable charm and a playful edge that teases and satiates your curiosity.   The vibe: Entering the contemporary two-storey building, Resonance might not immediately strike you with impactful visual elements; the dining area is clad in white and minimalistic ornaments with only few decorated photos sparingly hung across the hall. This venue lets their dishes do the talking.    The food: Despite being branded as borderless, there are, indeed, conspicuous nods to Japanese accents interwoven in each plate thanks to capable young chef Shunsuke Shimomura, a former research and development chef for the OG Gaggan. His new seasonal tasting 14-course experience (B6,500) may not blow your mind right away, but the layers of subtlety accumulate and fit into a larger jigsaw. Our experience started with hotaru ika (Japanese firefly squid) topped with creamy burrata and completed with eminently potent crab soup blended with asparagus and bamboo shoots. Hoy mara (murex shell) locally sourced from the Gulf of Thailand, served inside its pink spikey columella, was plump and accentuated with savory mousse, but we wished it had more acidity to add a dynamic edge. We loved the sand white fish, deep-fried piping hot and wrapped in shiso leaf, revealing the luscious interior. Another interesting take was shiro ebi tea soba, in which Shimomura mixed matcha powder with flour. The moderately thick, freshly-made noodle offers refreshing tastes when paired up with the firm and pleasantly chewy shrimp. The showstopper, however, was the spring roll stuffed with crab, cinnamon, pickled ginger, and shredded coconut; there’s a satisfying sensation when you crunch your teeth into this crispy roll bursting with full flavor. Why we’d come back: Shimomura’s creations pack a punch on par with other long-established venues—the prices, too. Something to try next time is the highly-praised tea-pairing (B1,200), which you have to book two days in advance.
summary: A modern, minimalist venue offers a unique borderless fine dining experience with playful Japanese-inspired dishes. Seasonal tasting menus highlight the chef's creativity, featuring fresh ingredients and surprising flavor combinations. Perfect for culinary enthusiasts, each course invites curiosity and satisfaction.
address: 108, 4 สุขุมวิท 65 Khwaeng Phra Khanong Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110, Thailand

name: Gaston
description_full: The buzz: Spasso has been rebranding its space since last year, but with 31 years of history tied to the name and the place, changing the food was never going to be enough. So, with more hard work, Spasso is dead, long live Gaston—a cooler, hipper French bistro in the basement of Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok. The vibe: You’ll find more color and fun decorations, bringing a livelier atmosphere. Forget what you know about formal hotel dining, Gaston has a casual, inviting vibe and sometimes the smiley chef David Senia walks around the restaurant to make sure everyone is having a good time. The food: The menu isn’t complicated. You’ll be able to find all the casual French bistro favorites here, and that’s exactly what Bangkok needs; mostly restaurants aiming for European cuisine go for the fine dining and luxury aspect. Find casual and easy-to-understand French dishes like the steak frites set (B1,890 / shared between 3 people) where you can choose between Australian black angus ribeye, Australian lamb chop, grilled tiger prawns, and seared sea bass filet—every order comes with unlimited fries. Other French favorites include duck foie gras de canard au torchon served with fig chutney and brioche (B720). The previous menu at Spasso before the new name didn’t have onion soup and we’re glad to see it on the new menu this time (B420). For dessert, you can’t go wrong with the crepes suzette served with Grand Marnier, orange, and vanilla ice cream (B310). Why we’d come back: While Grand Hyatt Erawan still holds strong with that classic hotel image, the team has been working hard to revamp a lot of aspects, especially the food and drinks. This brand-new revamp from a vaunted restaurant is a welcoming one in a city obsessed with European fine dining.
